Good morning,

Luke 22:31, “And the Lord said, “Simon, Simon! Indeed, Satan has asked for you, that he may sift you as wheat. 32 But I have prayed for you, that your faith should not fail; and when you have returned to Me, strengthen your brethren.”

Failing makes man miserable and it’s because no one wants to fail. If you have a standard you’ve set, or one set for you, the last thing you want to do is fail. Hearing the words, “You’ve failed!!!” makes your heart faint because failure hinders you from moving from one point to another. Failing either leaves you stagnant or moves you a step backwards. Failing is lack to perform, ineffective or deficient. It’s to be unsuccessful, it is to decline. Fail (failure, failing) don’t paint a pretty good picture does it? Yet in our lives there is a great chance to fail. How often do we hear about failed marriage, grades, heart failure, failed to perform etc. It’s an indication that something did not live to it’s expectation.

Imagine Peter standing and telling Jesus just before he is taken away that he will not fail Him, Mark 14:27, “Then Jesus said to them, “All of you will be made to stumble because of Me this night, … ” 29 Peter said to Him, “Even if all are made to stumble, yet I will not be.” A standard Peter had set and he wanted to stand by it. Looking at where he had come from with Jesus, there was nothing else that could cause him to fail as he might have thought. Jesus knew Peter very well and knew that his spirit was willing to stand but his flesh was weak to stand the test because of the enemy of the flesh. What if someone told you that you will fail on what you plan to succeed in?, what would your reaction be? get angry with them or quit? What if someone told you that before you get to where you want to get to, be ready to have some setbacks, will that change your direction and zeal for success? Jesus said to Peter, “Satan has asked for you, that he may sift you as a wheat” Jesus is telling Peter that though he has a desire and wants to stick by it, he should be ready for a setback cause Satan was going to sift him as wheat. I would say Satan was going to reveal to him some things in him that needed to be worked on and Jesus said, ” 32 But I have prayed for you, that your faith should not fail; and when you have returned to Me, strengthen your brethren.” . Taking a closer look at what Jesus said, it would reveal to me that even though Satan had desired to sift him as wheat, Jesus prayer was that only chaff would pass through the sift and the wheat, the good seed will remain in the sift. If you are like me, you would sit down and wonder why Jesus who had power over Satan did not stop him from allowing him to cause Peter to have setbacks. I believe that this experience was going to help him in the life that was a head of him since Jesus was going back to heaven.

The setback was not to kill or destroy him, the setback was to prepare him for even greater things. Judas Iscariot had a setback, to him it was a failure and you know what happened to him, to Peter it was a setback yes but a channel to greater things. We can’t quit living because we have setbacks, God has given opportunities and avenues for a come back, The bible says Proverbs 24:16, “For a righteous man may fall seven times And rise again…” Thank God that what we call failures he considers as temporary setbacks. His word is an open book exam, if we fail, we can take the test again. So if you failure in your exam, performance in the job, whatever it is, remember failures are temporary setbacks, you still have a great great chance for a come back. You only fail when you quit. Blessings Ev

Math 21:9, “Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”

Blessed according to the dictionary definition is INVOKE A DEVINE FAVOR UPON, Is that wonderful or what? Let’s get some more definitions on it, to make holy by religious rite; sanctify is another definition. To continue with the def    inition, blessed it is to confer wellbeing or prosperity on. Blessing is a divine favor from above, it comes down from a blessed Father extending His blessings to a people who do not deserve it never will. The difference between blessed and blessings is that blessed is already favored and blessings is bestowed.

Over and over again through out the bible, you will come across the word blessed and blessings, it’s a reminder to us that the same Father of blessings is still favoring His people even today, all we got to do is be in our rightful position to receive it. Mark the way I put it, not having everything in place but being in the right place doing the right thing and awaiting Our Heavenly Father to rain blessings on us.  Psalm 1:1 starts in a very interesting way, “Blessed is the man who walks not in the counsel of the ungodly, Nor stands in the path of sinners, Nor sits in the seat of the scornful”. Believers should set up a standard for the unbelievers to look up to and not allow world to set up a standard for believers. Blessed are we when we set up standards not according to the ways of man, but according to the ways of God.

Giving to the poor may not necessary mean giving someone material things but giving our spiritual things. People can be poor spiritually and with one depositing encouragement, joy, smile to their account, they will be gaining back what they lacked and what a blessing to be in a position to bless someone else. title.rendered: Distinct Responses to the Life of Jesus Christ 2 By David Jackson (Mentor & Friend of Pastor Phil)

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Focus Matthew 1:18-2:11

Matthew chapter one revealed Joseph, the just Jew’s” response to Jesus, and Matthew chapter 2 shows the response of the “wise” gentiles toward the person of Jesus Christ.

The origin of the “wise men” is shrouded in speculation and obscurity. In eastern/Greek-influenced cultures, foreign subjects were required to symbolically and ceremonially pay tribute to their sovereigns. “Wise men from the east” suggests that the men traveled a great distance from some wild, exotic place to Jerusalem. The city of Jerusalem was understood to be the home or source of godly things.  The title of “wise men” suggests that the group were educated and skilled. Historians agree that the “wise men” were trained in Babylonian astrology or the Zoroastrian priesthood. Although the men were foreign, pagan gentiles by virtue of their birth and skill, the men somehow were aware of the prophecies concerning
Jesus.

The wise men called Jesus the King of the Jews. The “Jew” is the person who faithfully lives according to God’s plan, and Jesus is said to be the Sovereign of the faithful group.

Another side note. Matthew records the occurrence of an extraordinary astronomical phenomenon; a bright star, whose light overshadowed the other lunar bodies, appeared to signal the location of Jesus, the King of the Jews. The narrative calls the bright star- “His star.” Genesis 1:17 established that God set the stars in the heavens “to give light upon the earth.” Here, the light from “His star” overshadowed the darkness of night to guide seekers to Jesus.

The wise men, then, are not wise because of their Babylonian astrology. They are “wise” because they decided to leave the darkness of where they were and follow the light of His star wherever it took them.  They followed until it leads them to Jesus where they worshipped Him and offered to Him substantial gifts which symbolized their surrender, faith, worship, and commitment (2:11).

Both the “just” Jew and the “wise” gentile had to come to the same revelation about Jesus. Both had to recognize Jesus’ unique Identity. Neither was just or wise in ands of themselves, but became just and wise by looking to Jesus. The narrative teaches us that Jesus is both Savior and Sovereign. Whether we seek God’s pardon or His guidance and leadership, we MUST look to Jesus. Looking to Jesus would require us to acknowledge our sinfulness as Joseph did without regard for how that confession would reflect on us before others. Looking to Jesus would also require us to acknowledge how lost and in the dark we are as the wise men did and leave our darkness and follow the light to Jesus- where we would offer Him our commitment and worship.

Do you want to be just and wise? Then go to Jesus. Amen.

title.rendered: Distinct responses to the life of Jesus Christ, By David Jackson (Mentor & Friend of Pastor Phil)

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Focus Matthew 1:18-2:11

In the first two chapters, Matthew records two distinct responses to the life of Jesus Christ.  Interestingly, the story of Jesus’ birth focuses- not on the wonder of the virgin birth, per se- but on how Joseph will react to the dilemma posed by the question of whether Mary is pregnant from unfaithfulness or by the power of God.

Under the law, Joseph’s considerations are important because Joseph could have Mary stoned or banished from the community if he declared the pregnancy to be illegitimate (1:19). Whatever Joseph said concerning Mary’s pregnancy would have a life or death effect on Jesus’ Life.

With that in mind, Matthew calls Joseph- just. Being “just” connotes right-standing, maturity, honesty, integrity, being moral, and being honorable.  Justification is the status of being blameless-“having nothing on the account”. No known historian records anything bad about Joseph. He was known for his character. Thus, Joseph was “just” because he kept short accounts with God and people. He was a man of integrity. He practiced forgiveness and mercy and experienced God’s grace as a result of his lifestyle. Because of his character, Joseph was the right man at the time to be father to the Lord, and thus, was selected to participate in God’s plan with relation to Jesus.

You see, all of Joseph’s life lead him to and prepared him for this very moment. Joseph HAD TO recognize how God worked to achieve His purposes by acknowledging that Mary’s pregnancy resulted from God’s action. A lot was riding on this and Joseph could not afford to miss the point! Like everybody else, Joseph HAD TO acknowledge and accept Jesus’ Identity. If Joseph denied Jesus’ Conception, and declared His Life to be illegitimate, the community of faith would not have accepted Jesus. Therefore, an angel appeared to Joseph in a dream to guide Joseph’s understanding and declared the Conception to be by God the Holy Ghost, Who is the Agent of divine activity on earth. Joseph heard the angel declare Jesus to be the Savior (vs. 21).

One side note. Because a person’s name carried great significance in the western/Greek-influenced cultures, the “mystery” Child’s Name had to be correct. Greeks believed that God personally superintended the naming of children. This carried over into Hebrew customs.  They believed that after a Jewish child was born, God caused the father to publicly declare the child’s significance to the instant family and community when he announced the child’s name. In Jesus’ case, the angel told Joseph to call the Child- Jesus, (in order to fulfill prophecy) because Jesus would save His people from their sins. Now, Joseph immediately understood that IF he publicly called on a savior, then he would, in effect, be publicly calling himself a sinner. Joseph would publicly acknowledge personal sin by calling out the Name of Jesus, the Savior. But, being “just” required Joseph to act justly in order to become “just”. So Joseph acquiesced and publicly called the Child- Jesus, and thereby, acknowledged his own personal sinfulness and need for the Savior in the face of what his declaration meant to his own integrity, dignity, status, position, prestige, and popularity in the community. Can you imagine what the other people in the community thought of Joseph when he comes out and publicly calls the name of Jesus? I’m certain many speculated as to what was going on in Joseph’s life; perhaps, he was fudging on his tithe, or maybe he had another mistress over in Bethany.

Look at the text. Consider what Jesus’ names meant.  Jesus = saves people from their sins (Isaiah) Immanuel = God with us / (Matthew) Emmanuel = God in us Matthew’s understanding of Isaiah’s prophecy takes an interesting twist in regards to Jesus’ name. To Matthew, the Messianic reference meant more than God walking with humanity. In Jesus, God took up residence INSIDE of humanity. Joseph uniquely understood that salvation from sin would come from God taking up residence on the inside of humanity- the KEY to the Christian salvation experience.

The narrative of chapter 1 reveals an important lesson: Joseph’s radical obedience resulted from God’s visitation. I believe that divine visitations are the source of proper human decorum. If this is true-Joseph, then, is no hero- BUT an ordinary person who simply responds to God’s initiative in Jesus’ birth.

Right?   Joseph showed the reaction of a loyal, “just” Jew to the birth of Jesus.  Continuing  in chapter 2, the story shows the response of the “wise” gentiles.  To be continued…

Good morning,

Genesis 30:1, “Now when Rachel saw that she bore Jacob no children, Rachel envied her sister, and said to Jacob, “Give me a child, or else I die”

If I was to ask different people about how they think about themselves, I will have a long list. I believe you have something about you that you don’t like. If God was to give you a chance to design who you would like to be, most likely you would have a complete different picture as to who you would like to be. If you are short, your design could have the tall features in it. If you are skinny like me, you might have muscles in mind when designing the new you. Every time you look in the mirror there is part of you wishing that you could change some things about you. Human beings tend to concentrate more on what they don’t have or what something someone else has that they forget to look at what they have. We at times feel that we have nothing to offer and there is nothing in our lives that other people can admire and therefore we belittle ourselves because of what we think. Psalm 139:14, “I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made; marvelous are thy works; and my soul knoweth right well”. You and I are skillfully, wonderfully and uniquely designed to fit in this world. You are not in this world by accident and you did not just come about. The Porter took the time to make you in an image that no one else in the while world is like you. There may be people who look and sound like you but there is absolutely no one like you. In other words, you have no competition cause no one can beat you being you. Look at the design on your thumb, there is no one in the world who has the same design as yours. You are unique, with unique qualities, unique design and there are certain things that no one can offer but you .

My text this morning introduces us to two women who happens to be blood related sisters. We are told about Rachel and Leah. Two women married to one man. Both women are from the same source but are very different. They are unique in their looks, personality, age wise and many more things. The husband likes each of them and appreciates each of them differently based on their capabilities. I want us to understand that we can belong to God but be very different. The difference is what brings in the individuality and uniqueness that we ourselves can appreciate God for. As we are talking about these two women we see that Leah is the hated one, she is not as pretty as Rachel, she does not get all the attention she desires but on the other hand, she has been blessed with the fruit of the womb, she is the oldest and that entitles her to get the first service, she has children who can attend to her and she is respected because of the fruits of her womb. When you talk about Rachel, she is the young one therefore she is served last, remember Jacob worked seven years for Rachel but ended up with Leah and therefore Rachel had to wait for 14 years before her dream was fulfilled. She has not been favored to have children and with that she is not getting the same respect as Leah. She doesn’t have children to send, to call her own and something to be proud of. Looking at what she doesn’t have, I see on the other hand she is beautiful, she is loved more than Leah, she is given the best gifts, she gets the best attention from her husband and yet with all these she is not happy. I saw this with Hannah and Penninah. And because of what Rachel saw in Leah, she envied her, jealousy cropped in and began to cripple her. I don’t know what to say but I think the same must have happened to Leah therefore she tried to have more children to try and cover up the pain inside of her rejection.

You don’t have to agree with me on this but I would say that it is very hard to be happy for someone when you think that what they have should have been with you instead of them. I also believe that it is very hard to fully appreciate the good things in someone’s life when you don’t see what has been invested in you. Concentrating so much on what someone else has and neglecting to see what you have will always have attendancy of crippling you down for contentment in your life will be missing. Rachel could have looked at the different areas that she had been favored and say, “Well even if I don’t have this and that, God has given me this and that “. My point is very simple, look at how God designed you to know that you are unique and have no competition. As you might admire what someone else has, remember that they could be admiring what you. Understanding what you have will make you appreciate the gifting and the uniqueness in you that in turn someone else gifting and uniqueness will not be a threat to you but rather you will rejoice with them over the blessings from the Lord. Instead of envying them and being jealous, pray that God will bless them even more and let your prayer be, “Lord as you bless them, remember me”. The Lord said, I will bless them that bless you and I will curse them that curse you. You curse someone because of what they have, you are bringing a curse upon yourself but when you bless them, you too bring a blessing to yourself.

Genesis 30:1, “…Give me a child, or else I die”. What a tragedy to look to someone to perfect you instead of going back to the manufacturer for something you don’t have. Rachel made a big mistake by thinking that it might have been Jacob’s fault that she wasn’t having children and this was his response, “Am I in the place of God, who has withheld from you the fruit of the womb?”. Suppose she blessed Leah and looked to God for her help, I believe God would have opened the fruits of her womb. Blessings Ev

My Church Pastor has been dropping bomb shells, Sunday after Sunday in Church. The message last Sunday was yet another Bomb! He spoke about P R I D E, the top most of all SINs ! ! !
  I’ve been tempted ever since to speak more about PRIDE…. in our message today, let me talk about different subtle forms of pride
#1 It is called the “I am Special” pride!
Symptoms:
-You get offended, when your name is not mentioned in the address book of a thank you mail! You may not display it though!
-You wouldn’t completely accept apologies of errors by others! e.g. someone accidentally spills coffee over you… they apologize – even offer to buy you another shirt… but deep inside your heart, you are still so upset!
-You would rather wait for someone to greet you first (especially your subordinates/associates)… till that time you are busy ignoring the other person..!
-You expect personal invitation at all invites.. failing which you’d rather choose not to attend – even if its a good friends celebration …
-and incase someone you missed you in their invite list, for whatever reason, you begin to brood over it… and never quite get over it…
-you seem to get offended at the slightest gesture of casualness by a new friend or a family relative…! and even give it back at times!!
#2 It is called the “I am invincible” pride!
Symptoms:
-you have a tough time accepting, or considering for that matter, suggestion given by colleagues / sub’ or anyone else!
-you donot entertain people who challenge you or correct you..! you’d rather keep away and maintain distance …!
-you avoid contact with people whom you think have a higher potential compared to you…
-you get extremely offended when your associates seek help for complicated cases from your friend and not you..!
-you don’t maintain eye contact when you wish your associates back …
Do you know that God considers PRIDE as the top most of all sins. He detests the PROUD! It was Pride that brought Lucifer down!

Good morning,

Hebrews 10:35&36, “Cast not therefore your confidence which has great recompense of reward, for you are in need of patience so that after you have had done the will of God you might receive the promise.

Hebrews 10 talks about a lot of things like the law, sin, the one who perfected the issue of sin for once and for all and what it is actually doing, it’s introducing us to many things that ultimately we may be built up in Christ. God is in the business of forming and filling, Hebrews 10:9, “Then He said lo I have come to do thy will oh, God, He takes a way the first that He may establish the second” We are the second God is establishing in these last days and therefore we have to be in our rightful positions for Him to establish us. Hebrews 10:23, “Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering for He is faithful that has promised”. I am being reminded that as I am being formed and established, many afflictions and trials are going to come my way but I am not expected to quit as many times I have felt like, I am encouraged to hold fast, cling to what I profess and that is my faith in Christ, I have made a declaration, a firm stand to hang on to my salvation for that is what will save me after it has been said and done.

When you come down to verse 35 of Hebrews 10, when one calls you for a greater task, hell wont rejoice for you, hell can’t even applaud and if that is not enough, many people are not going to support you either. I have seen people give up their faith because friends criticized them and made fun of them and spoke behind their backs. When you reach heaven you will not give God an excuse that you gave up on Him because of what you perceived and what people said about you. Cast not therefore your confidence which has great recompense of reward, we are not talking about your confidence in people or even in yourself but your confidence in Christ. Phil 1:6,”Being confident of this very thing, that He who has began a good work in you will perform it until the day of the Lord”. Your confidence in Christ will choke your confidence in men. With this kind of confidence, I choose to believe what God says over what people and circumstances say about me. Your confidence in Christ does have a reward as you position yourself to believe God in all that you face. After it has been said and done, your confidence in God will open channels for rewards. Watch this in Hebrews 10:36, “For you are in need of patience…”, we are all in need of patience to build our confidence and patiently waiting for the manifestation of the Lord , James 1:4, “But let patience have it’s perfect work that you may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing”. You can see that the bible does talk about letting patience do it’s thing without dictating it, rushing it and even trying to fix it but letting it do it’s work for it has a way of perfecting us. The more you have patience with God and in God, the more you can trust Him that regardless of the time He brings the promises, we will have patience to await for it. Hebrews 10:36″… so that after you have done the will of God, you might receive the promise”, We all want to receive the promise but the question is, are we willing to do the will of God? When God promised Abraham that He would bless him with a son, the promise was there, patience was needed for the promise to be fulfilled and confidence in God was also needed for these ingredients work together but I believe after some time he lost the confidence in God, patience and therefore they created their own promise Ishmael while the true blessing Isaac was to be fulfilled at God’s given time. The funny thing is that the false blessings really looks like the true one but the problem is, it has a way of fighting the true one, it will try and make you satisfied with it that you stop looking to God for the true one. I have made up my mind that I don’t want no Ishmael for he is not from God, I would rather wait for Isaac who is the true blessing. Ishmael is the fake blessing, he is a copy and not the original. Are you going for an Ishmael blessing created by man (you) or are you going for Isaac blessing made by God.? Are you interested in the original version or the copy? Doing the will of God is sticking to the plan till the end no matter what it takes and that is our struggle everyday. It’s only when your confident in Christ stands, your patience supersedes what you define as patience and stay in His will that’s when the promise is received and fulfilled.

I pray that we will not loose our confidence in Christ by any means, that we will be patient to await God’s timing, that we will stay in the will, that in the long run we might receive the promise. Patience is awaiting God’s timing without doubting His love and capabilities. God is able to fulfill His promise if we do our part. Now don’t blame God when you choose to go your way, He is not a man that He should lie neither is He the son of man that He should repent, If He said it, sure enough, He will do it.

Have a blessed day full of promises.

title.rendered: He Called Me What I’m Not, Part 4

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Judges 6:11-40&7:1-25, “…The Lord is with you, you mighty man of valor”

Judges 6:33, “Then all the Medianites and Amelikites, the people of the East, gathered  together; they crossed over and encamped in the Valley of Jezreal” as you can tell these people are coming camping somewhere in readiness to attack Gideon and his people again like they have always done, vs. 34&35, “But the Spirit of the Lord came upon Gideon; then  he blew the trumpet, and the Abiezrites gathered behind him, and he sent messengers throughout all Manasseh…Asher, Zebulun, and Naphtali; they came to meet him”. I’m beginning to see a different Gideon for the first time since we started talking about him. Remember how he would hide when he knew that their enemies were coming. We hear about the Spirit of God coming upon him, he begins to exercise the calling for what He was not, now He is because of the Spirit of God. When the Spirit of the Lord comes upon you, He empowers you to become what He had called you which is a sign that you will take less and do much with it. He is a leader gathering all 5tribes to listen to him. I ask myself, don’t the tribes know who he was and how he came from the smallest family in Israel? well let’s be reminded that the Favor of the Lord would cause you to be favored by many. I saw it when Jesus was getting into Jerusalem riding on a donkey, people were casting their garments, leaves, robes and cloaks on the ground that the donkey (favored donkey) would ride on it, now let’s not get over heel thinking that when we see them do the same before us that they are doing it for us, they are actually doing it for the Man who sits on the donkey and to us the Man who sits inside. 1John 4:4, “Ye are of God, ye little children for you have overcome them, for greater is He that lives inside of you than He that lives in the world”. I know we have used this line “than he that lives in the world” in reference to the devil but let’s look at it again, greater is He who lives inside of me than me (I, myself) who lives in the world. He who lives me is greater than I.

Let’s jump to Chapter 7:2, “And the Lord said to Gideon, “The people who are with you are too many for Me to give the Medianites into their hands, lest Israel claim glory for itself against me, saying, ‘My own hand saved me”. Oh great!!!! our friend has gathered 5 tribes adding up to about 33000 people ready to fight. He believes that the greater the number, the greater the victory. I have been in positions where I knew God was doing and He did not use what I thought He would. Please don’t start loosing heart because what you thought the Lord was going to use in your life is actually contrary to what He had in mind. Many who had dreams and visions for their lives and Spirit of the Lord was upon them but when the Lord chose to go a different direction, they got offended and terminated their dreams and visions before time, marriage is one of them. So if the Lord did it your way, you might think that it was by your own efforts and ability and God would not allow it for He is a jealous God.

Judges 7:3, “Now therefore, proclaim in the hearing of the people, saying, “whoever is fearful and afraid, let him turn and depart…” And 22 thousand of the people returned and ten thousand remained” mmmmm sounds like the time the buddies you thought would stand with you forever when the going got tough and a little test came their way, they were the first ones to leave. Psalm 118:8, “It’s better to trust in the Lord than to put you confidence in man”,. Then the Lord says well you still have a big number and I can’t give you victory with this multitude, now let me choose your friends vs. 4, “But the Lord said to Gideon, “The people are still too many; bring them down to the water, and I will test them for you there…” Vs 5, “So he brought the people down to the water. And the Lord said to Gideon, “Everyone who laps from the water with his tongue, as a dog laps, you shall set a part by himself; likewise everyone who gets down on his knees to drink, vs. 6, “And the number of those who lapped, putting their hand to their mouth was 300 men” and the rest were sent back home. This always come back to me, Mathew 22:14, “For many are called but few are chosen” 33000 men were called but only 300 men were chosen. There is a great reason for the test, the rejected ones were the ones who went down on their knees and drank from the river, these were selfish people who cared about themselves, they were also careless for they were not keep their heads up to see when the enemy would strike. Those who lapped like a dog, they were the right people for the job, they were not ashamed to make a fool out of themselves before the Lord, they are cautious because as they scoop the water and lap out of the hands, their eyes are set to see if the enemy is coming, they are the type of people God knows that whatever He tells them to do, they will obey, they had the same spirit Gideon had. These are FAT people. I want to be FAT and I believe that would be your desire. Now let me tell you what a FAT person is before something happens to me. FAT stands for Faithful, Available, Teachable, Gideon was faithful, Available and Teachable and so was the three hundred men, you miss the quality of being FAT, you are missing a lot for I believe down deep within my heart that God can not use THIN people but FAT people. Do you want to be used of God? if so be FAT, you have to be faithful in serving the Lord, you have to be available to be used and you got to be willing to be taught. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: Secret Blessings Revealed – Part 3, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“When you fast, do not look somber as the hypocrites do, for they disfigure their faces to show men they are fasting. I tell you the truth, they have received their reward in full. But when you fast, put oil on your head and wash your face, so that it will not be obvious to men that you are fasting, but only to your Father, who is unseen; and your Father, who sees what is done in secret, will reward you (Matt. 6:16 – 18).”

Fasting is one of those spiritual disciplines that seem to be a stumbling block especially for American Christians.  Does Jesus expect Christians to fast or not?  Keeping the Word of God in context during this series Jesus spoke previously of “when you give” and when you pray.”  Is giving optional?  How about prayer, is it optional?  If neither of these two disciplines is optional, then in context to the Scriptures, fasting is really not optional either.  Jesus was assuming people would give, pray, and fast but once again, He was examining the heart of these disciplines as they are appropriated in the Believers life.  Like giving and prayer in secret, there is a blessing attached to fasting in secret as well.  All three of these disciplines really shouldn’t be separated but are to all be practiced within one’s life.  Men fasted but did not share their food with the hungry (Isa 58:1-7). During a time of fasting Jesus pointed out the manner in which He desires that one carries out ones time of fasting and they are as follows:

Fast with Joy.  Perhaps this sounds like a bizarre point.  Jesus instructed that one’s face shouldn’t appear as one that just sucked on a lemon.  Rather Jesus says that one must conceal one’s hunger out of one’s love for the Lord.  Fasting should be a time of feasting on God’s Word, and in God’s presence.  This should not appear as a grueling task commanded by Jesus as a lording task master.  This is a period that God is calling you to deny your flesh in order to have a spiritual buffet of His Word.

2.    Fast with giving.  Giving, prayer, and fasting should be three fingers of the same glove.  In Isaiah 58, God said about fasting, “Is it not to share your food with the hungry?”  Who do you know that can use food?  Why not share a short meal with someone.  Even buying a stranger a few items on the McDonald’s dollar menu will be a blessing to him or her.  Who are you giving to as you fast, and pray?

3.    Fast with secrecy.  One does not need announce one’s fasting time.  Making others such as your spouse or children so that they may understand why you are not at the dinner table is helpful.  But when one is asks by another person, “what’s wrong,” and the reply is “I’m fasting” the response just manifested the insincere heart of the Believer claiming his or her fast.  Go to the prayer closet, and commune with the Lord, and see what great things He speaks into your life.

4.    Fast with Hunger.  Jesus has given us a weapon in fasting God’s way (see Isaiah 58).  Many Believers don’t use this weapon and therefore it remains ineffective in their lives.  God has taught me many things during times of denying my flesh, for a period of fasting, and I have needed each lesson He gave.  God said that if we would give, pray, and fast, then He would reward us openly.  Learn how you can get the benefits God has for you as you fast in secret but are rewarded openly.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

let me list out a few individuals that we come across in our daily lives… people whom you run into every other moment, at various walks of our lives…!
the under-grad security person, who insisted that you display your ID card…! and you inturn brushed him aside and walked away!!
the cab driver who wouldn’t move the car, unless you fastened your seat belt…! and you spoke rudely to him!!
the usher who asked you to remove your car from where you parked it! but you inturn got into an argument with him and even gave him a piece of your mind!
the customer service representative who was trying to explain to you their company late fee policy, but you went on to argue and even mislead…!
the watch man of your friends apartment, who wouldn’t let you in, as you couldn’t remember which flat your friend stayed in! and you got upset and shouted at him!
the traffic cop who stopped you for a routine halt! you realized he couldn’t speak in English, and you said stuff that you otherwise wouldn’t have said…
the new employee in office, who was collecting your leave data!! you wouldn’t give it to him the 1st time!
the young choir master who asks to join step with the rest of the choir…! but you seem to have a problem with that..!
the lady in the ticket counter, who asked you to wait for extra long.! you made a scene out of that..!
the new guy in the church refreshment counter, who asked you not to jump the queue…! and you tell him, chill bro’, I’ve been here for years!
you pastor who encouraged you to keep your mobile in silent mode!! you seem to be forgetting it every week!!

title.rendered: He Called Me What I’m Not, Part 3

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Judges 6:11-40&7:1-25, “…The Lord is with you, you mighty man of valor”

Judges 6:16, “And the Lord said to him, “Surely I will be with you, and you shall defeat the Midianites as one man”, Our God is full of promises that He keeps, David reports God’s faithfulness in keeping promises in Psalm 37:25, “I have been young and now I am old, and I have not seen the righteous forsaken nor his seed begging bread”,  2Corinthians 1:20, “For all the promises of God in Him are yea, and in Him Amen, unto the glory of God”. God promises Gideon to be with him and then He promises to help him defeat the Midianites. Let me make a point here, the promises of God can only be fulfilled if you stick with the plan. Jesus stuck with the plan by going to cross though painful. At one point He desired that the cup of suffering would pass Him, nevertheless He said, “not my will but Your will be done”. By the time Jesus was done, He came out as one man and the same is promised to Gideon if he stuck to the plan. Can we as believers reach to that place where we speak the same words?

Willingness and promise requires a change, for in verse 18 of Judges 6, “The he said to Him, “Do not depart from here, I pray, until I come to You and bring out my offering and set it before You.” And He said, “I will wait until you come back”. Gideon has encountered with the truth, for the first time someone has told him something about himself he never knew about, he has been promised God’s presence and victory, he is so blessed by what he hears that he cannot afford to loose the opportunity to always be in the presence of the Lord. When you encounter with the truth like Gideon you can’t miss the opportunity of always wanting to be with the one who has revealed to you who you are, has promised to always be with you and has also promised victory. For Gideon his time of receiving ended now it was his time go give, he goes to the house to bring the best sacrifice to offer before the Angel of the Lord to the Lord. Human beings in general are selfish people it’s about us, about our gratification, about what I can gain out of it. We always love to be in the receiving end but to effectively walk with God, there is receiving and giving, Luke 6:38, “Give and it shall be given to you…”. Jesus was the Master yet He gave, God so loved the world that He gave and so can we. Sacrifice is foregoing something for the sake of someone else Hebrews 13:15, “By Him therefore let us offer sacrifice of praise to God continually, that is, the fruit of our lips giving thanks to His name”, where you want to go will cost you time, availability, faithfulness, teaching, money, sleep, reaching out to the unlovely, washing all manner of feet, it will cost you to pray even fast. If it doesn’t cost you anything, I wouldn’t call it a sacrifice. Gideon goes and prepares a sacrifice brings it over and it’s presented to the Lord. I thought that is all that he needed to do and all would be fine but there is more.

Judges 6:25, “Now it came to pass the same night that the Lord said to him, “Takes your father’s young bull, the second bull of seven years old, and tear down the altar of Baal…”. Basically this means that now you got to bring down everything that is a hindrance to your move, things that are more important to you than God has to come down, if you’ve been worshipping a person, position, your money, your favorite game, they’ve got to come down. Gideon was not forced to bring them down, he was told and now the decision had to be his, Judges 6:26, “and build an altar to the Lord your God on the top of this rock in the proper arrangement”. It’s tough to bring down what you consider valuable to you but who will you choose?  it’s scary even for Gideon but he knows that either now or never, he is scared of bringing that which they love but for the sake of his people, family, community, himself he is compelled to do it. What sacrifices have you made to walk effectively with God? what altars have you brought down and built that you know were not of God? Are you willing to change? nand if so, what are you doing about to change? Blessings Ev

To God’s question, “where is your bro’?”, check out Cain’s reply! “Am I my brothers keeper ?”  I am certain that Cain, being the eldest. was taught by mom and dad to take care of his younger brother! Good morning,

Judges 15:18 Because he was very thirsty, he cried out to the LORD, “You have given your servant this great victory. Must I now die of thirst and fall into the hands of the uncircumcised?” 19 Then God opened up the hollow place in Lehi, and water came out of it. When Samson drank, his strength returned and he revived. (NIV).

The desire to be victorious in every area is a thirst every one craves for.  A desire to let everything run smoothly in one’s life yet we find that there are times you are victorious in one area and a failure in other areas. We are like trees that go through different seasons, the winter, spring, summer and autumn. If you took time to look at trees in these different seasons, you will discover that there is change on how they look. During winter time, their leaves are gone. For someone who may not know might conclude the trees are dead but the truth of the matter is, they are alive and well adjusting to the season in which they find themselves in. their existence is not dependant on the season, their existence is dependant on the roots that have gone deep underground in search of water and nutrients. So the days they may not look attractive, they still have a way of surviving one season while they wait for the next season.

Is this different from a life of a believer? I don’t think so, we too go through different seasons. There are seasons of great victories, the seasons where everything you touch is blessed, every move you make prospers then there are those times that everything you touch is a disaster. The seasons of defeat, every believer have different seasons. The key is to learn to adapt in every season, causing your roots to go down deep into the ground in search of water provided by the Almighty God. Meanwhile you await and prepare for the next season.

In Judges 15, Samson had such a season of great victory. By just a jaw bone of a donkey, he had killed a thousand men. What a huge success, great victory not by his own hands but by the help of God. Then out of the victory, right in the sun, tired and existed, he thirsts for water. He turns to God and cries out to God, “”You have given your servant this great victory. Must I now die of thirst and fall into the hands of the uncircumcised. This is to say, “God if you gave me victory over one area, will you let me be defeated in another area? He desires water that may give him strength to survive the heat of the sun. He desires water to revive him to face another season. It’s sad to know that there are people who abandon God when they find themselves in a season that is not comfortable being in, like Samson, right in that hot season, we can cry out to God for water, His words to give us strength and revive us. Just as the disciples said, “John 6:68, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life”, seasons had changed for them too from being fed with bread to being fed with the word, many stopped following Jesus and the disciples too had a chance to leave. They knew that instead of turning away in a new season, they desired to cling to the water giver and that is what they did. Amazing thing about seasons, they change but God remains the same and believers can learn to adapt in every season Hebrews 12:2… looking unto Jesus, the author and finisher of our faith.

title.rendered: Secret Blessings Revealed – Part 2, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“But when you pray, go into your room, close the door and pray to your Father, who is unseen. Then your Father, who sees what is done in secret, will reward you (Matt. 6:6).”

In part one of Secret Blessing Revealed, Jesus emphasized that one that gave in secret would be blessed openly.  Now He shifts to speaking about secret prayer.  Jesus assumes that His disciples would be men given to prayer, but He forbids the prayers of “hypocrites” which means to be an “actor,” placing a mask on one’s face in front of people but taking that mask off behind the scenes.  In Jewish life prayer had a prominent place that led to countless rabbinic decisions.  Jesus is not forbidding public prayer, but rather he stresses the attitude in prayer, and true character is what you are in the dark when no one is looking.  Jesus therefore gives us instruction of having our secret prayers from our prayer closet manifest in the blessings that God would reward us on.

Practice your prayer life.  Jesus assumes, and rightfully so, that His children would speak to Him.  If Christians are followers of Christ, how can one follow if one fails to communicate with the One they are following? Although prayer is assumed here, how many Christians are consistent in prayer other then saying grace at a meal, or a quick bedtime prayer?  Do you have daily time when you talk with your Savior and He speaks with you?  Jesus spent hours in prayer and seconds performing miracles.  His disciples saw this time and time again, but instead of asking Him, “teach us how to do miracles,” they asked Him, “Lord, teach us how to pray.”  The one, prayer, affected then other, performing miracles.  Hours in prayer equaled seconds performing miracles!

2.     Create a meeting place.  In the life of Jesus, he regularly would separate himself from others, even His twelve at times, to seek a place of prayer where He could commune with His Father.  Jesus would wake up early in the morning before anyone else and would find refuge in His prayer time.  Jesus would find a place where he was not distracted, nor could not be disturbed in prayer.  Jesus said, “Foxes have holes and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head,” yet despite being without a home, he always managed to find a place to pray.  Do you have a place where you meet with God?  Do you go there often?  Is that place a priority?

3.    Pray in private then in public.  Again Jesus is not forbidding public prayer, but if one prays more in public, Jesus says that one seeks the praise of men over the praise of God.  Go into your room (your place of private prayer), close the door (to keep free distractions), placing yourself on “lockdown” whereby you know that it is time to meet with God and no one or nothing else matters at that time.  This is the most important time in your day!  When you pray in private watch how God uses you then to pray in public, and how He can speak through you on behalf of others, because you are already doing that in private.

4.    The Father, rewards secret prayer.  Remember that you are communing with your Heavenly Father, and He will make His children shine like Job, Daniel and his friends, etc….  Send your prayers up, and watch the blessings come down.  Practice your prayer life, in a private meeting place with the Father who rewards your secret prayer.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

title.rendered: Secret Blessings Revealed – Part 1, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“But when you give to the needy, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing, so that your giving may be in secret. Then your Father, who sees what is done in secret, will reward you (Matt. 6:3 -4).

If you are like me, then perhaps you too have that little something inside of you that likes to be recognized by others for doing a good job or good deed.  I enjoy blessing others, and I find myself sharing some of the ways in which I have blessed people with others.  I don’t do it to brag as if to say, “Look what I did for the Lord,” but rather I see it as a way to express how God is using my life to bless other people.  In His Sermon on the Mount, Jesus speaks of being able to bless others through giving, but doing so in secret.  He speaks of giving to the needy around us, specifically to fill a financial need.  Jesus instructs His children not to be like some politicians, that announce their beneficial giving to society so that they can win votes with people, or as Christ said to receive “the glory of men”.   Jesus focused on giving in secret, and that those secret blessings, would be revealed.  Our Lord gives practical instructions of how to give in this unfamiliar way, the secret way:

Don’t Keep Score.  We are to give to the needs of men and women in such secrecy that we scarcely know what we have given.  Jesus said “do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing.”  Our giving should be prompted by the desire to obey God and with compassion to meet the needs of others.  I believe men, much more then women, like to keep score on relationships.  If I bless someone, does Christ want me to keep a mental score of what the one that received my blessing should do for my when I want or need something and expect them to deliver on it?  Giving to get is not the heart of Christ, therefore it should not be the heart of those bearing His name.  Jesus gave His very life to us, and we can never return that sacrificial expression of love to Him, but He did it for us anyway.

2.    Don’t Showboat.  When someone is trying to purposefully impress others that, they are showboating.  This is precisely what Jesus is instructing us not to do, “toot one’s own horn.”  If anyone had bragging rights, it was Jesus.  However, can you picture Him speaking with His twelve in this manner: “I healed fifty people today, how many did you heal?  5,000 people attended my sermon and I fed them all, how many stayed for your sermon, and did you feed all of them?”  By no means did Jesus pride- fully speak like this.  Jesus blessed, and gave, and blessed, and gave, and then moved on to do it again.  At times Jesus would bless someone and tell them to keep it a secret from everyone except the priest (Matt. 8:3-4).

3.    Recognize the Secret Blessings Revealed.  I was blown away after preaching about Psalm 23 in college to the men on my floor.  Upon returning to my room, I found a book at my door called A Shepherd’s Look at the 23rd Psalm, with a note reading, “Thank you for sharing with me what I needed to hear, sincerely, a fellow sheep.  That person should have seen my excitement, and perhaps one of the guys walking by was secret blessing giver.  I challenge you to unplug your scoreboard, cease the showboating, bless in secret, and watch secret blessings revealed.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

title.rendered: He Called Me What I’m Not Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

For the next few days, I will share a 4 part series of devotions that blessed my heart in 2002. The message came about after I was invited to speak to a group of people who were on parole seeking God for direction. May you be blessed. Ev

Judges 6:11-40&7:1-25, “…The Lord is with you, you mighty man of valor”

In the book of Judges 6:11 begins by saying, “Now the Angel of the Lord came and sat under the terebinth tree which was in Ophrah, which belonged to Joash the Abiezrite, while his son Gideon threshed wheat in the winepress in order to hide it from the Midianites”. We all love to encounter with God Himself, His Son, The Holy Ghost and the Angels, any time when we feel like we are alone and no one cares, there is always a way God will reach out to His people. In the story if you begin from the previous chapters, we find how Israel had disobeyed God and how God brought Midianites, Amalekites and the people of the East to come against them. The reason why this came to them was because of the idols they worshiped and because of that some were taken captive and some were hiding in the caves, mountains and under some sacred tree where Gideon was found. Gideon is hiding so as not to deal with the present situation, he feels like there is nothing more to live for, he has lost hope and confidence, he comes from one of the poorest and youngest family, he is hiding in shame, despair, weak, broken, rejected, abused, feeling like a failure, confused wondering where is God when I need Him the most. Have you ever been in a situation where all you felt was a victim of circumstance and you wondered what is wrong with me that I have to deal with all these?, where is God when I need Him?, He seams to be blessing everyone else but me?, My neighbors are happy, my friends seam to get it all together, their families are not broken like mine. Ever felt like some people were getting promotions but you?, you seam to be trying very hard but they keep raising up someone instead of you?, have you ever been somewhere where everything wasn’t working right?, you try to say the right thing but it comes out the wrong way?, you try to succeed but you keep failing? I know some have felt this way and that is what our friend Gideon also felt and because of that, all he would do was thresh wheat under winepress. He has stopped trying, he doesn’t see any future out of it and so what is left to do is sit there and call it a quit. In his dilemma, the Angel of the Lord shows up, sits down under the tree and watches what Gideon is doing in his lost thoughts.

6:12-13, “And the Angel of the Lord appeared to Him, and said to him, The Lord is with you, you mighty man of valor. Gideon said to Him, “O my Lord, “if the Lord is with us, why then has all this happened to us? where are all His miracles which our fathers told us about,….now the Lord has forsaken us and delivered us into the hands of the Midianites”. Here is a man who has suffered for a period of time, the Angel of the Lord shows up and tells him, “the Lord is with you”. Lord if you are with me, how come I am suffering?, if you are with me, how come I had to go through this and that?. You know what, we don’t have to feel the Lord to know that He is present, the bible calls Him Jehovah Shammah which means that He is present, when you think He wasn’t there He was actually there. You may have not felt like He was doing anything but be assured He was there and in the case of Gideon, He was always there and yet Gideon did not know why I’m I saying so? If God wasn’t with him, he could have been captured, he could have been killed, terrible things would have happened but because God was with him, none of these happened to him. You might have been wondering where the Lord was when you broke up with your girlfriend or boyfriend, where was He when you lost your job, when you were sick, when they lied on you, when they prevented you from receiving what you know was meant for you, where was He when your parents went through a divorce, where was He???????. You did not feel Him when you needed Him and now He shows up and calls you what, “mighty man (woman) of Valor”?.

I got to stop but I have to say that whenever God is going to lift someone up, the rooted issues have to be dealt with and squared out for where you are going doubts, fear, un answered question cannot come with you for they will be an hindrance to what He wants to do. Gideon is launching His complain but all he needed to understand that regardless of what he went through and had to deal with and though the presence of God was always there, he needed to appreciate the fact that He manifested himself in other words revealed Himself and that would mark a beggining of something greater and tell you what, whenever the Lord reveals Himself, know that there is something in store. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: Snatching Them From the Fire, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Please keep the prayer requests I have at the bottom of this devotion at heart. Blessings Ev

“Be merciful to those who doubt; snatch others from the fire and save them; to others show mercy, mixed with fear-hating even the clothing stained by corrupted flesh.” (Jude 22-23)

Recently I was watching the movie Volcano starring Tommy Lee Jones about a volcano that erupts in downtown L.A.  I began to meditate on one scene in particular whereby a group of firemen are down in the subway rescuing unconscious people that are aboard a train.  While the men are carrying people to safety, the fire chief goes to the next car on the train and picks up an unconscious man, but sees the lava headed his way melting all in its path.  The fire chief selflessly carries the man through the train, and his shoes are starting to melt.  When he gets to where the lava is flowing he has a choice to either drop the guy on the floor, leaving him for dead, thus saving his own life or he can jump into the lava and throw the victim to safety.  The chief chooses to jump into the lava flow and throw the man to safety causing the chief to be consumed by lava.  This scene reminded me of the verse from Jude which speaks of “snatching others from the fire and saving them”.  To have the actions like the fire chief Christians must be willing to do the following:

Be where lost people are.  The people aboard the train were lost and unconscious until the firefighters searched the train.  Most Christians disconnect with all their unsaved friends with the first two years of their conversion to Christ.  I understand that relationships need to change when one is converted to Christ, but most are unbalanced in the manner in which they do so.  As a result many forsake those Christ died for by severing relationships with the ungodly, rather then to be “a friend of sinners” like our Savior.

2.    Pick up lost people (not in the dating sense).  The fire fighters did their jobs to pick up the lost that were in danger of burning in the lava flames.  As Christians it is our job to pick up relationships with the lost purposefully to try and lead them to the only safe haven from the flames of Hell and that is Christ, the Living Water.

3.    Some need you to deal with them very directly and vigorously. The chief just grabbed the victim in urgency, because it was a life and death situation.  Salvation is God’s work, but Christians are God’s instruments for snatching brands out of the fire (Zech 3:3). The picture is of a person slipping into the eternal fire but rescued from error by the grace and truth of God carried to them by a Christian.  Darrell Robinson said “The world says you can’t confront people with Jesus; you’ll run them off. Where are you going to run them to? Hell number 2?”

4.    Be selfless.  The fire chief gave his own life to save the unconscious victim.  What is the worst thing that can happen to you when sharing your faith?  You can be rejected or killed (being killed is unlikely).  However what is the worst thing that can happen to the unsaved person?  They end up in Hell.  Who, may I ask, has a worse outcome?  No of us want to feel rejected by others.  Christ and His twelve were rejected on many of occasions.  If we are preaching the Gospel according to Jesus there will be those that reject us as well.  Choose to purposefully be around lost people being a “friend of sinner,” pick them up, deal at necessary times directly and vigorously with a selfless attitude toward them.  Seek and save the lost like out Master, because the harvest in plenty, but the laborers are few.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

title.rendered: The Saddest Day in Heaven, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Co 3:12 If any man builds on this foundation using gold, silver, costly stones, wood, hay or straw, 1Co 3:13 his work will be shown for what it is, because the Day will bring it to light. It will be revealed with fire, and the fire will test the quality of each man’s work. 1Co 3:14 If what he has built survives, he will receive his reward. 1Co 3:15 If it is burned up, he will suffer loss; he himself will be saved, but only as one escaping through the flames.  (1 Cor 3:12 – 15)

I heard a message many years ago which focused on the saddest day in heaven that bears repeating.  Although all true Christians will make it to heaven the Scriptures says that some will suffer loss; he himself being saved, but only as one escaping through the flames.  What “loss” could someone suffer in heaven?  What could cause any day in heaven to be a sad one for any believer?  Paul is imploring us to live our lives with the end in mind in 1 Corinthians 3:12-15 as he shares the following thoughts:

What are you made of?  Notice that there are three materials mentioned which are cheap and temporal and there are three which are costly and eternal.  Which are you made of?  Does your life material, your character represent what anyone can find while taking a walk in the woods or what is rare, precious, and costly?

2.    There is a testing Day coming.  Most people hate pop quizzes.  Paul reminds us that the testing day of what we are truly made of is coming, and it should not be a surprise to us on that Day.  While non-believers will be judged in righteousness, Christians will be judged on their works unto the Lord.  Are you ready for such a Day?  Paul reminds us of the urgency of being ready for this test on God’s calendar.

3.    The Fire Will Reveal All!  What is the result when one burns up wood, hay, and straw?  Ashes.  However, what happens when gold, silver and precious stones are burned up?  The dross (the impurities) surface until all that remains is the pure precious metal.  It was the valuable metals and precious stones (Rev 21:18-21) that were used to adorn ancient temples.  Are not we too the temple of God (1 Cor. 2:12)?  The fire is not testing the quantity built rather the quality of what you are made of, and the fire won’t lie, but will reveal!

4.    Giving a worthy Gift to Christ.  What do you desire to lie down at the feet of your Lord and Savior, ashes or precious metals?  We only have this one life to live.  This is why Christ Himself commands “But store up for yourselves treasures in heaven…For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.”  Will your face be shining in the precious metals you lay at Christ’s feet, or will your face be saddened in the ashes of temporal works?  I believe many will be saddened knowing that they could have stored up the gifts He desired.   Examine what you are made of; remember the Day is coming when the fire will reveal all.  Give Him a worthy gift, one that He sees not only your reflection in, but more importantly His reflection!
Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

Good morning

Romans 8:31, “What shall we then say to these things? If God be for us, who can be against us?

One of the greatest struggles in our days is to have someone whom you can trust. Experiences has caused some people to be skeptic about who they can trust. Trust is very fragile. Someone said it’s easy to mend broken love than broken trust.

Joshua 5:13, “And it came to pass, when Joshua was by Jericho, that he lifted his eyes and looked, and behold, a Man stood opposite him with His sword drawn in His hand. And Joshua went to Him and said to Him, “Are You for us or for our adversaries?”. It’s is very important to know who is on your side and who is not. The reason is simple, he who is on your side believes in you and the ability you have and knows who you are to be able to help you do the right thing. In my text, Joshua is about to go to the battle field, he sees a Man ready for battle. Just looking at the scripture and how the words have been placed, I am utterly convinced that he saw the Lord. Read the verse yourself and you will see these word’s first letter in caps Man, You, His, Him. Whenever I see such word’s first letter in caps, I know the bible is referring to the Almighty God. What a comfort to know that the person whom you thought was against you is not but for you. It’s like I have come because You need me.

Two things to bring to our attention GOD BE FOR US AND GOD BEFORE US. Romans 8:31, “What shall we then say to these things? If God be for us, who can be against us?. I know of many people who are living today with the understanding that God is against them. It’s disturbing to me because I understand that whoever is against you has an aim to destroy you by all means. I believe that the reason why some people think this way is because they called on God for something but He never came through for them or God allowed them to go through something and to them that was a sign of God being against them. Suppose we asked our earthly father to do something and he did not, does that mean he is against us? he is for us, meaning he is on our side looking for our well being. The bible says, “If God be for us” which is interesting because I was hoping that it would say “When God is for us”. Had the bible used  “WHEN” that would imply that God is not ready yet to be for us for He is in the process of being ready. For sure we know God is always ready. The word “IF” drops the ball in our court because we are the ones who allow God to be for us. Joshua understood this concept because there was a Man (God) who showed up ready but through the question he asked Him showed that the Man was ready to be on someone’s side and that was Joshua’s. So it’s Joshua who needed to allow Him to be for them. We have God on our side friends always but we have to allow Him to be for us”.

GOD BEFORE US, this becomes the tricky one. “God be for us” just means He is on our side but God before us means that not only is He on our side, He is also leading. Joshua 5:14, “So He said, “No, but as a Commander of the army of the Lord I have now come. And Joshua fell on his face to the earth and worshipped, and said to Him, “What does my Lord say to His servant?” It’s easy to have “God for us” but the most important thing is to have “God before us”. The Man who appeared came in as Commander and we know commanders lead and give orders. With this understanding, not only did Joshua allow him to be for them, he also allowed him to go before them. He knew that the man was for them and not against them for He says I have come. Can you trust Him enough to be for you and go before you? Proverbs 3:5, “Trust in the Lord with all thy heart and lean not on thy own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge Him and He shall direct your paths” blessings Ev

Good morning,

“Therefore my beloved brethren, be steadfast, unmovable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as you know that your labor is not in vain in the Lord.”
(1 Corinthians 15:58)

In 1938 Orson Wells showed America the great power of the media with his “War of the Worlds” broadcast.  His announcement convinced multitudes that Aliens from Mars were attacking New York and New Jersey.  His compelling broadcast had scores of people shaken.  Harlem in NYC was one of those places that were severely shaken.  “The parlor churches in the Negro district, congregations of the smaller sects meeting on the ground floors of brownstone houses, took the “news” in stride as less faithful parishioners rushed in with it, seeking spiritual consolation. Evening services became “end of the world” prayer meetings in some (New York Times, Oct. 31, 1938.” (http://members.aol.com/jeff1070/wotw.html)

The Apostle Paul in 1 Corinthians 15:58 writes too of what perhaps sounds like a “War of the Worlds” type broadcast as he describes the rapture (the snatching up quickly) of the church at the sound of the trumpet.  However God’s Word is not a science fiction broadcast but a true account of what happened “In the beginning,” and what will take place in the future.  Therefore, as we, The Church wait for this Great Day, Paul doesn’t instruct us to run around like lunatics with a big sign reading “The end is near” while we scream “Repent while you still have time.”  Paul rather gives sound down to earth applicable instruction of what the Body of Christ is to do as it waits for the return of Christ.  He writes, “Therefore” hence because this is going to take place, “my beloved brethren” those that I love listen to me.  Then he touches on three characteristics for believers to have in place as they actively wait for Christ’s return as they are as follows:

Be steadfast.  The Christian life is not a sprint but a marathon, as Solomon reminds us “The race is not to the swift… (Eccl. 9:11)” As believers we need to embrace and exhibit a stick-to-itiveness spirit, an attitude of perseverance.  The word quit should not be in the vocabulary of a Christian as it pertains to following the Lord.  Paul said “However, I consider my life worth nothing to me, if only I may finish the race and complete the task the Lord Jesus has given me.”  Run the race and refuse to give up.  When the going gets tough, and your spiritual leg muscles are weary wait on the Lord to renew your strength (Isa. 40:31)” and “…be strong the grace that is in Christ Jesus (2 Tim 2:1).”

2.    [Be] Unmovable.  Be stable.  This world is a very unstable place that can’t ever seem to make up its mind.  The Christian although living in the world is not of the world and therefore needs to show the world stability in Christ in their midst of the instability of this present world controlled by the god of this world (the devil).

3.    [Be] Always abounding in the work of the Lord.  What do you do for the Lord?  Are you a Sunday Morning Christian only?  Most Christians don’t have the work of the Lord in their schedules because much of their work is for themselves or others.  Paul employs that we abound in God’s Work.  Whose work are you abounding in?  Are you as efficient for God as you are for your employer?  When you exhibit these godly characteristics you do it for the service of the King and therefore “your labor is not in vain in the Lord” as you are spurred to serve the Lover of your soul.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

These verses talks about John the Baptist. In today’s message at Youth alive, the speaker said one thing that applies here. For God’s kingdom to come, he uses the man’s kingdom. John’s witness was essential for our belief for Jesus to start His ministry. Its quite an irony, that the words of the man who was sent by God was more accepted than God’s own. But the importance of man testifying is also tackled quite early by John the disciple. Through a human being’s witness only many believe. I guess that’s why Jesus says what he says about wonders and signs. I guess miracles and wonders can keep you in awe, but a witness of a person only can make people truly believe in God. The 8th verse might have been for people at that time who believed John the Baptist with an inclination to make him more important than Jesus Christ…That’s just my view.
And what was John’s witness …Jesus , the true light that gives light to EVERY man was coming into the world…that word ‘every’ is quite often overlooked. So Jesus came to give everyone His light..He came for everyone .

These verses emphasize the importance of being a witness. I really enjoy the witness time in church. Message is a whole other thing when compared to witnesses. When someone stand as a witness to God it touches us. What is a witness? Witness is nothing but testifying what we see or have seen. John was to stand as a witness to testify the greatness to that light. The light that is going to bring eternal life to many. But you know what I keep thinking, why did people believe John and not Jesus as he was right in front of them doing all the miracles? To continue. Blessings Prathima & Shalom

title.rendered: The Two Sides Of The Same Glory, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Then the angel of God, who had been traveling in front of Israel’s army, withdrew and went behind them. The pillar of cloud also moved from in front and stood behind them, Ex 14:20 coming between the armies of Egypt and Israel. Throughout the night the cloud brought darkness to the one side and light to the other side; so neither went near the other all night long.”  (Exodus 14:19-20)

Isn’t it amazing that tow people can be right next to one another in church and one engages God and the other doesn’t?  Jesus said, “Whoever has my commands and obeys them, he is the one who loves me. He who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I too will love him and show myself to him.”  God has a way of showing Himself strong to those that are His, while those that are His enemies see a much different side of Him.  At the Red Sea there were two camps present.  One camp was the camp of the Israelites while the other was the camp of the Egyptians.  The angel of the Lord went in between the two camps, and although there was only one angel, each camp had a different perspective they saw emanating from the same angel.  Like two sides of the same coin, both camps were in the presence of the same angel but each had vastly different experiences.  Those two experiences teach us some great truths about God.

Even though the enemy pursues, God will protect His own.
The angel stood between the two camps, protecting Israel from their armed enemies.  The more you give of yourself to the Lord, the more the enemy will pursue you.  Peter reminds us that, “Your enemy the devil prowls around like a roaring lion looking for someone to devour.”  Sometimes as in this case as the Pharaoh sent out his army after the Israelites so will Satan send people your way to pursue and stop you from going to the Promised Land.  The Good Shepherd stands in between the sheep and the goats.

2.    The ungodly see what they love – darkness, while the godly experience light.
“This is the verdict: Light has come into the world, but men loved darkness instead of light because their deeds were evil.”  The Egyptians saw darkness and certainly had evil deeds with murder, and slavery on their minds.  When you are pursued to be brought back into bondage and your enemy looks to kill you, keep your eyes on the light which exposes the darkness.

3.    The double nature of the glory of God is salvation for God’s people and
judgment for His enemies.  God’s glory was salvation for the Israelites and
judgment for the Egyptians.  Both camps were just moments away from getting what was coming to them as a result.  Israel would soon walk by the light of the Lord on a dry road through the Red Sea.  However the Egyptians in darkness would soon pursue Israel and the darkness of the waters of judgment would come upon them in an unprecedented proportion bringing them to their death.

The presence of the Lord is a sure help in times of trouble.  Paul wrote if God is for us who can be against us (Rom 8:31).  He can prepare a table before us in the presence of our enemies (Psalm 23:5).  God will protect His own, in the light of His salvation.

Until the nets are filled…
Blessings, Pastor Phil

Good morning,

John 1:3-5″ 3.Through him all things were made; without him nothing was made that has been made. 4.In him was life and that life was the light of men.5 The light shines in the darkness , but the darkness has not understood it. ”

After calling Jesus , ‘ The word’. the third verse is aptly put…that all things were made through him. God said ” let there be light and there was light” …. God had to say ‘The word’ Without ‘The word’ nothing could be made…meaning He was and is the root of all creation. Without Him there would be no creation. I am wondering if we extend that to the inventions man makes, coz that also involves creation.. to the new things man created , does God play a role…if yes then is he also involved in the bad inventions man made, like nuclear bombs and other harmful things. I think if we observe the creation, everything that brought life or was useful for life only was a result of the creation in those 6 days. So for any life giving / life helping or life complimenting creation the root is in God. I think all useful creativity comes from Him, our talents, skills , wisdom all can become useful if they come from the right source. HIM. What do! you think?
Coming to the fourth verse..cant help but go back to Genesis for this. Both light and life were the main basis of things created then ..the other basis is water and land too. So putting these both together…Light and life both were in Jesus, out of him came the creation…again supporting the third verse. Its like the story of creation is told in that one verse and the first 2 and the 4th and 5th verses support and amplify it.
The fifth verse describes God throughout history , present and all time. In all ages, during the prophets, during Jesus, and after Jesus. His Godliness has always been in front of men but they hardly understood it. I cannot say Jesus was always known to people but no one understood Him, bcoz if that was true then Jesus wouldn’t have said to his disciples to Go and tell the gospel in the world. I think everyone knows who God is, what His nature is like, but the darkness in their lives doesn’t let them understand it. If Jesus is called the Light then the opposite..the darkness is obviously Satan…cud be sin also. Like its pointed out in NIV ‘darkness has not understood it’  is also written as ‘ darkness has not overcome it’  in some scripture…What do you think the connection is? That’s kind of unclear. These are just 5 verse but they say so much. ..almost everything for a believer.

It is said in the bible that we are made for His pleasure. God made us so that we can glorify and magnify His name. There is no human existence without him. We are made from nothing into something. The life application bible beautifully describes this verse by saying “because we are created beings we have no basis for pride.” We are after all dust yet so proud of our form. God has created everything so beautifully and wonderfully, but are we fulfilling His purpose or running behind our own. In Revelation 4:11 it says “You are worthy, our Lord and God, to receive glory and honor and power, for you created all things and by your! will they were created and their being.”

“In Him was life and that life was the light of men.” The word light holds a lot of importance in describing God. Like you said God is light whereas darkness represents Satan. And that light is in man to show that we are God’s children. Made after his own image. Once again going back to life application bible it says “Why is eternal life in Christ a light to all mankind? Because death brings eternal darkness, and only Christ’s eternal life planted in us will keep us alive in His kingdom for eternity.” Amen.

“The light shines in the darkness, but the darkness has not understood it. ”  “The light shines in the darkness” Wo! truly when the sun comes up there is no way we can see darkness like wise when we make the light of the world Jesus our personal savior there is no place for Satan. The light can take away darkness but can darkness take away the light? I think not. In this light we dare to see ourselves for who we really are, sinners, yet the promise of forgiveness stands out. The promise of eternal life in Christ. AMEN.
