it was a popular number by the eagles in the early 80’s… but again, this message neither has anything to do with that song, nor will it make you loose your mind!
Fasting(or feasting, as my wife calls it), is a very popular practise amongst God’s children, as mentioned in the Good book!
So how does “Life in the fast lane” look like!
Each time there is a need that has to be met or a problem that needs to be fixed, we goto to God in Fasting and prayer!
there is absolutely no harm in doing that! Infact it is pleasing to the Lord’s eye!
but what is important here is – the perspective / the motive behind fasting!
ask yourself these questions :-
– Are you fasting because, you believe that God answers prayers only when you FAST?
– Do you fast only when you have needs lined up, and you believe that unless you FAST, God won’t act upon them?
– Do you believe that FASTING is a must, and every Christian ought to be FASTING every Friday?
– And that God is disappointed with those who donot FAST!!
– Does God need your FAST, for Him to be able to work in your life? 
– Will God change His mind and not bless you because you didn’t FAST?
  Guys, please!! Our God is a loving God! His gifts are irrevocable! He doesn’ take back what He promises! Even His Holy Spirit!
He keeps HIS word, unlike us! He never breaks His promises! There is nothing you can do to make Him stop showering His choicest gifts on you!
  Jesus planned to bless you / to fulfil your hearts desires /  to meet your needs / to promote you /  to bless you with a child / to prosper you, much before you had even PLANNED TO FAST!!
So what is it now! Does that mean we do not fast anymore ? NO! 
Fasting:-
What a wonderful act of submission it is? It is a beautiful way to go to the Lord, in supplication, in reverence!

content.rendered:
Good morning,
It gives me pleasure to share with you a message that was sent to me by one of new devotion team members. She had been so much blessed by the messages and decided to email and encourage me. I got so blessed that I asked her to share some more, here is part of the message. Be blessed. Ev
John 1: 1-2; 1.In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. 2.He was with God in the beginning.
The first thing that strikes when anyone reads this is the similarity it has with Genesis 1:1…In the beginning God created heaven and earth. So ‘The Word’ existed before we did, before the heaven and earth. And He was with God and He was God…It sounds kind of like the trinity don’t you think? The pastor at AG’s anniversary celebration talked about this, He said ‘In the beginning ‘ in Genesis stands for the timetable God had for humanity, His plan for us. since God has no beginning and end, it cannot mean that first there was God…coz God has no beginning or end. So I guess ‘The Word was God’ supports what he said. When I thought more about the word and how we use it in daily life, I realized that after the word ‘God’ and ‘Love’ , ‘Word’ is the right way to describe God. Through God was everything created…when He said through His word it was created. Everywhere we see there are words, every work is done by words, everything has words associated wit! h it. Relationships that are formed are based on words said, even for people who cannot hear, words still exist..they do not have sound but they exist. Words are more effective when understood, they have the power to make or break lives. When people are deprived of words..when they cannot express what they want to that’s when comes pain. I can go on and on, but the most important thing is that they are the most taken for granted thing in life..sometimes the most underestimated power…just like God don’t you think. So what am I saying? That ‘The word’ probably wasn’t used as an experiment, it does hold meaning , probably not a coincidence that ‘The word’ is what every Christian uses to refer to the bible. Another thing, generally when we say I give you my word, it means our promise…so I don’t think it would be wrong to say that ‘The word’ means God’s promise to humanity…who is none other than Christ. And while doing my daily devotion, I accidentally came to this verse Ps:119:74 “May those who fear you rejoice when they see me, for I have put my hope in your word” So from what John 1:1 says, that would mean that all who hope in Jesus will be blessed in such a way that everyone who knows God will rejoice seeing them. Quite amazing.
I chose the Gospel of John because I have heard so much about this book but never really took the time to read it in depth. This is the book we are meditating in church also. There is no beginning or end to God. He was is and always will be. I really like the notes in NIV on the term “WORD.” It talks about how John wasn’t just talking about the spoken words but also unspoken. These verses talk about God being eternal. I think John is a very talented writer. Unlike Matthew, Mark, or Luke who start with the genealogy of Jesus John starts the gospel with an introduction. An introduction that gets you thinking from the very first line. Sometimes we forget Jesus is God but John starts with saying Jesus is not someone who was just born but he has been there since the beginning. Way before the heavens and the earth were made. He starts with the most important concept of Christianity which is TRINITY. Most of the time it is forgotten that Jesus is GOD. But John in a very subtle yet powerful way reminds us that He is the beginning and the end. Its starts and ends with Him. By Prathima

title.rendered: Between a Rock and a Hard Place, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning

I think we’ve all faced times in our lives when we felt like we were in a situation and all the options seemed to be trouble. I think of Harrison Ford in the Indiana Jones movies because his character always seemed to find himself in such a position. He would be in a situation where on one side men with swords were attacking him, and on the other side the spiked walls would be caving in on him. Somehow he always came out alive and with his hat as well. That is Hollywood, but life plays some similar situations toward us at time. When one is between a rock and a hard place, going forward is trouble, going back is dangerous, and remaining in place is disastrous. This is where Israel found herself when Moses led them out of Egypt, out of bondage only to stand before the great Red Sea in Exodus 14:13 – 16.

“Moses answered the people, “Do not be afraid. Stand firm and you will see the deliverance the LORD will bring you today. The Egyptians you see today you will never see again. Ex 14:14 The LORD will fight for you; you need only to be still.” Ex 14:15 Then the LORD said to Moses, “Why are you crying out to me? Tell the Israelites to move on. Ex 14:16 Raise your staff and stretch out your hand over the sea to divide the water so that the Israelites can go through the sea on dry ground.” There are some great promises and challenges in this passage of Scripture and they are as follows:

God sees the situation behind you and instructs you not to fear.
If Israel were to go back they saw themselves being slaughtered by the Egyptian Army. As humans fear can be thought of as a natural human trait, but there are so many verses in which the Lord instructs us not to fear, and “If God is for us, who can be against us? (Rom. 8:31)”

2. The Lord will fight for you, you need only to be still (remain)
If Israel were to stay in place they would be protected as long as God was there to protect them. “Do not be afraid or terrified because of them, for the LORD your God goes with you; he will never leave you nor forsake you (Duet. 31:6).” The Israelites had just seen the Lord previously bring down ten distinct plagues on the Egyptians and the Israelites had no part to play in causing any of the plagues to hit their enemies.

3. Don’t sit there are cry about it, Move on!
God called to move on, but to where into the Sea? This initially presented a major problem until the Lord gave further instructions. God gave Moses the command to raise his staff and stretch it over the sea to divide the waters so that a dry new road could be made without the use of construction machinery, builders, contracts or blueprints. Despite resources God can use the ordinary things of ours to do extraordinary things when we obey Him as we use the common object which in this case was a shepherd’s staff. I can picture in the natural Moses stretching out his staff over the Sea, and in the Supernatural God using His hands to part the waters. God had a plan of how to move on, but Moses needed the faith to extend his staff, and walk between the two walls of water. The Lord will you encourage neither to go back nor to fear the past and that He will fight for you in the present as you remain still. However, when God tells you to move you had better get going because that is where the miracle is. Where are you currently? Recognize God’s will at each stage.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

Good morning,

When a lion tamer goes into a cage with a lion, he brings his trusty stool with him.  Most think of the whip in hand and forget about the importance of the stool.  Why a stool, good question.  When the stool is extended toward the lion with the legs facing the lion, the lion tries to look intently at all four legs of the stool at once and it causes the lion to become dizzy and therefore tames it.  Perhaps it would be more fitting to call the stool the lion tamer then the man holding the stool.

Just as the fierce and mighty king of the jungle can be tamed with because of focusing on all four legs at once, so too can the Christian be “tamed” by focusing on too many things are once causing one’s mind to become boggled just like the lion’s.  This is what I believe that the Psalmist was feeling when he cried out to God in his writing “Teach me Your way O Lord; I will walk in Your truth:  unite my heart to fear your name.” What are the four most important priorities in your life?  Perhaps your four are in the following list:  family, work/school, finances, ministry, exercise, friends/relationships, hobbies, etc….  Now is God the focal point all of your priorities?  In Psalm 88:11, the writer gives us insight into how to not live in so many directions at once, but how to live with SINGLENESS OF HEART.

Teach me your way O Lord.
Realize that God has a way about Him just like you have a way about you.  Isaiah 55:8,9 reads, “For my thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways my ways, says the LORD. For as the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways…”  When we handle our priorities in God’s way, he will be the center of those priorities because they will revolve around Him just as the earth revolves around the sun as it rotates on its axis.  God desires that we learn His way of doing our priorities.  God’s ways are found in His Word, in prayer consistent with His Word, and through the advice of mature believers that live consistent to God’s Word.

2.    I will walk in your truth
First one must learn God’s way, then one can walk in the way of truth.  This is the step or appropriating God’s way, actually doing in practical ways in your life.  When God is central then his way in your life will be central, thus appropriating His way in your life will cause your way to be aligned with His and you will walk in His truth.  Jesus said, “…If you abide in My word, you are My disciples indeed.  Then you shall know the truth, and the truth [you practice] shall make you free.”  James instructs us, “But be doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving yourselves.”

3.    Unite my heart to fear your name
John Bevere wrote, “One will submit to and serve whatever one fear.”  The heart cry of the Psalmist is to have his divided heart united and submit to the Lord by fearing His name.  His name is Lord, which is to say He is in control, and deserves to be in control of your life.  Abraham tested to see if he had a divided heart or a united heart when he was commanded to offer Isaac on the altar.  God tested Abraham on the very blessing (Isaac) that God gave him and Abraham showed his love for God outweighed his love for his son.  “The fear of the Lord is the beginning of Wisdom…”

Live with singleness of heart unto God learning His way, doing His way, and Fearing Him so your life will be aligned with His will.  God will never let your down.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

Thanks
Evans

Good morning,

16 When I thought how to understand this, It was too painful for me– 17 Until I went into the sanctuary of God; Then I understood their end. 18 Surely You set them in slippery places; You cast them down to destruction.

“Finally the light bulb went on.”  Perhaps you’ve used this expression when someone finally understood the truth, concept, idea, message, and feeling, ect that you were trying to convey.  The In Psalm 73, the Psalmist    it seems had a similar experience when he wrote, “Until I went into he sanctuary [house] of God then I understood their end.”  The heavenly light bulb came on in the mind of the writer.

The author had previously been feeling greatly inferior to the wealthy wicked.  He was trying to live a morally clean life before God, and all he saw was the ungodly acquire more and more wealth and worriless living.  Have you ever felt this way?  Perhaps have been trying to live right before the Lord, but it seems that the ungodly are getting all the breaks, acquiring more wealth, and much “success.”  And if one were to freeze-frame at this point, one can be greatly discouraged in the flesh.  However this is not the whole of the story.  The Psalmist goes into the sanctuary of God to a revelation of the full picture of things.  He wrote UNTIL…THEN.  It was not UNTIL he went into “Heaven’s IMAX theater and was shown by God the whole picture, that is all the way to the credits, that everything was seen in its proper perspective.  The sanctuary of God is where God’s presence was and when he viewed things from God’s perspective, one guided in truth, he saw the wicked having all that they acquired, as if one ice, slipping away from them one way and their lives slipping into destruction the other way!  Suddenly, the feeling of grief toward the ungodly rose up in the heart of the psalmist, because he saw their latter end.

The catalyst however of this change of heart, of “the light bulb going on,” was because UNTIL he went into God’s presence, THEN HE UNDERSTOOD.    There are things that one cannot understand UNTIL one has been in the presence of the Lord.  The sanctuary was always there, but the writer had to enter into it.  We too, need to enter into the presence of God and gain the revelation of things from His perspective, which will affect our attitude and our very lives.  From the psalmists was initially standing his eyes only saw the prosperity of the wicked, but not the end of their lives, and himself being in material lack as compared to them.  Heavens IMAX Theater certainly showed him different, and then, I imagine that the feeling of jealousy turned to grief because they were sliding away from all they acquired and their lives sliding into destruction.  We need not jealous of the wicked if we spend time in the presence of God were God will remind us that we need to feel grief toward the ungodly and to reach them with God’s truth, because they are in need of righteousness.  Proverbs 11:4 reads, “Riches do not profit in the day of wrath, But righteousness delivers from death.”  When we realize that the ungodly will slip into Hell, and are heading their without Christ, we will have the reigns of our hearts pricked and will share the truth of their eternal destination with them, if they die without righteousness, with the Savior.  Jesus instructed us to store up our treasures in heaven, because he knows we cannot take anything with us, and all our worldly possession will not mean a thing to the Judge on Judgment Day, and that only righteousness with God will appease the Flawless Judge, God.

If you are not right with God, don’t wait, make the change and repent ASAP.  If you are right with God, then make the end of this Psalm your prayer and duty.  28 But it is good for me to draw near to God [in His presence]; I have put my trust in the Lord God [not in riches], That I may declare all Your works [to those who desperately need it].”

Until the nets are filled…

Blessings Pastor Phil

Good morning,

Genesis 39:33, 38,41, “Now therefore, let Pharaoh select a discerning wise man, and set him over the land of Egypt”…And Pharaoh said to his servants, “Can we find such a one as this, a man in who is the Spirit of God?”…And Pharaoh said to Joseph, “See, I have set you over all the land of Egypt”

One man was asked how he makes elephant sculptures off a tree trunk and his response was this, “I take the tree trunk, chop off out of it what does not look like an elephant and what I will be left with will be an elephant. Thereafter I refine that elephant to bring to a completion what I had in mind when I thought of making it”. I have read somewhere that  “leaders are not born but are made”. One of our mission statement at church is to raise leaders. Leaders are few cause we have so many followers. In as much as so many people don’t feel they are leaders or have the qualities of leadership in them, what they need is to have everything chopped off them that does not make them look like a leader and what they will be left with is what they need to be.

I believe that all of us have qualities of leadership. It may not be for a big corporation or group but a leader just over a person. What will take for that to happen is first determining who you are, where you are, where you want to go. Getting into conditions that will boost you to your destination. To bring a mental picture, look at an egg, if a chicken is expected out of that egg, then number one: it has to be put under a certain temperature which would lead to incubation and when it’s time is due, a chick will fight it’s way out of the shell. Remember that it had to be given the right conditions to develop from being an egg to being a chick. As long as it’s just a yolk, nothing will happen but when it matures into a chick, the shell is no longer it’s dwelling place. This mental picture shows me that we have the qualities of being leaders whether we know it or not, all that is needed is to be in a right  incubator. It’s okay to be an egg but when you know that you have the ability to be more than an egg, you will not be comfortable being one. You will desire to fight your way through. Often times a word that lingers within our hearts and mind is “I CAN’T”, that’s good cause you just passed the test and now you can be made one. Just because you can’t do it doesn’t mean it can’t be done. You have to believe in yourself, the people who believe in you and the Almighty God who will make it happen.

Joseph was a leader developed, for a while he was in an incubator of life being developed to be a leader. When he was but a young man, he was to me like an egg, comfortable being one but when he dreamt twice, the dreams triggered and awakened something inside of him reminding him he wasn’t all the Father wanted him to be. From making the mistake of bragging about how his household will bow before him, to being sold into Egypt, to being in Potiphar’s house, to being in jail to finally rising to power, I can see every part of his leadership being developed. Joseph being developed to be a leader recognized the leadership of someone else above him and he yielded to that leadership, he was first under the leadership of Potiphar and then Pharaoh. He was a man in authority and under authority, through his struggle in life, God developed the humility in him, a quality of a leader.

A servant’s heart is a required quality, this does not just come, it’s developed through a pattern of life. Mark 9:35, “And He sat down, called the twelve, and said to them, “If anyone desires to be first, he shall be last of all and servant of all”. Being a leader is not about bossing people around but leading by example, this has to be developed. Jesus was not a bossy leader but one that leads by example. Doing what many leaders of today would not do, being a servant of all. Joseph learnt servant hood through serving his brothers, Portiphar, the people in prison, the people of Egypt and his own. Wisdom was one of his leadership qualities, again we can see how foolish he was in the beginning but in due time, what was inside of him was developed to mature up. His interpretation of the dream to giving the advise on what was to be done was a God given developed quality the Egyptians needed. I wish I had time I would have talked more on Joseph’s leadership qualities.

You can see that it took time to develop his leadership skills but he was ready for it, he knew of his limitations but did not limit God. He may have not understood the leadership class he was taking but I believe he appreciated it in life because God put him in an incubator. That egg, the thing that was delicate, that which could not move, that which could not function beyond, and that which was small had to be awakened to push it’s way out to become more than just an egg. Do you see yourself as more than an egg? it’s okay to be an egg but not bound to stay an egg forever. There are so many things in you that have not materialized yet, you need to be in an incubator. Ask God to show you what you could be as a leader and let that trigger something inside of you to desire to be one. Blessings Evans

Good morning,

1Samuel 25:2-35, 32 Then David said to Abigail: “Blessed is the LORD God of Israel, who sent you this day to meet me! 33 And blessed is your advice and blessed are you, because you have kept me this day from coming to bloodshed and from avenging myself with my own hand”

If we are going to make it, we need to be open for advice and counsel. The reason we have counsel is because someone else sees what we are blind to see, is experienced, we have blocked out some things or just ignorant of it. I would say it’s hard for some people to take advice from their juniors or from the ones they feel they are superior to. Advice and counsel gives you a chance to add what you are learning new to what you already know to see far beyond what you could see with your limited knowledge.

Husbands are going to have to humble themselves to some wise advice from their wives and not feel like it’s robbing them of their position as a man and the priest of his home. A husband who is insecure within himself may not be willing to throw in the towel and seek advise maybe because he might feel his HUMILITY will be a SIGN of WEAKNESS. Humility is not a weakness, it’s strength under control.

32, “And David said to Abigail, Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, Who sent you this day to meet me.” David could have dismissed Abigail because she was a woman, and what advice would a woman give a warrior leading over 600 other warriors, a successful soldier promised to be king? What possible reason would make David heed to the advice of a woman who is not even his wife? Simple, HUMILITY. His humility to heed to the voice of Abigail did not rob him of his manhood and position if anything it channeled him to greater levels. He would have tried to impress his soldiers by not listening to her but the choice he made once again was out of humility. Abigail may have not realized that God sent her to meet David, David knew pretty well that it was God. Wives, do you realize God has put you in your marriage for a reason? And some of the wise advice He has deposited in you to give is to draw you closer to him as he sees how well favored he is to have such a wonderful wife who cares about his life, destiny and relationship? Proverbs 31:10, ” A wife of noble character who can find?  She is worth far more than rubies. 11 Her husband has full confidence in her and lacks nothing of value. 12 She brings him good, not harm, all the days of her life” (NIV). What a blessing to know that you are more than just a wife but a voice also that God can use to get your husband’s attention. What if marriage was created by God not to make us happy as number one reason but to teach us things about God we would not learn in any other way? That through it we are shaped in the image of God. I believe there are some accomplishments be it in ministry, work, society that will never be complete without being in a marriage. Abigail that day became a voice God could use to speak to David preventing him from bloodshed and messing the victories God had in line for him. We are blessed when we take advice and we are a blessing when we do.

Humility may appear to be a set back for some husbands but I believe it tailors him to greater things why, “God resists the proud but gives grace to the humble”. title.rendered: The Fruit of Continually Trusting God, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“But I will hope continually, and will yet praise you more and more.  My mouth shall show forth your righteousness and your salvation all the day; for I know not the numbers thereof.” (Psalm 71:14-15)

What are some things that you do consistently?  Perhaps you go to work, eat, sleep, pray, read God’s Word, go through your daily routine, or read these devotions.  Whatever are your daily routines you do them continually for a purpose.  For example you continually go to work so you can get paid and have enough finances to meet your needs.  Many people do certain things continually that are focused on “their kingdoms.” However when it comes the Kingdom of God do you see a continual pattern in your life, seeking His Kingdom?  The elderly Psalmist reflects upon his life and writes, “But I will hope continually.”  This is indeed trust.  Solomon in his wisdom instructs all to “Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.”  This is something which we are to do continually, and there is a rich promise attached to our diligence to adhere to the proverb.  The Psalmist continues with his continual hope in the Lord which results in praising Him more and more.  When one continually hopes in the Lord, and acknowledges Him continually, one will see the Hand of the Lord making his or her paths straight.  Just stay on the straight and narrow path, is a saying that I imagine you’ve heard.  When one sees God making one’s life to walk on the straight and narrow praise and erupts and then more praise follows.

Do you continually spend time with God, or continually “forget” or spend time with other things, people, and activities?  You will spend your time continually in one way or another, but can the Body of Christ and the Lord see your life and one continually centered on God?  That doesn’t mean that one need stay in their home everyday and pray and read God’s Word.  However it does mean that we continually, daily read His Word, because how can one say one is trusting in God unless one is in His Word?  After the praise more and more is expressed toward the Lord, more erupts from our lips.  The Psalmist experience proclaimed, “My mouth shall show forth your righteousness and your salvation all the day; for I know not the numbers thereof.”  Because He was hoping continually, and seeing God’s Hand guiding his path he praised the Lord more and more, and then he had to tell others.  We too are to tell, about God’s righteousness, that He is a constant, unchanging source of truth worthy of all our praises.  Do you talk to others about the great things God is saying to you, showing you, doing in your life or is that only for “church?”  We shouldn’t be concerned with the world’s notion that “religion and politics” should not be discussed at a table.  If a Yankee fan hoots and hollers at a game no one thinks it strange, but when a Christian is excited about God suddenly that Christian is a “fanatic.”  Do you see the inconsistency with the world?  God is consistent and calls us to be consistent with Him, and to show that consistency to others.  The Psalmist concludes saying that he would show forth the salvation of God all the day, because he knows not the numbers thereof.  One thing one can never do in heaven is evangelize the lost, because no lost, unsaved person will be there. Are you proclaiming the salvation of the Lord to others?  Most Christians talk to other Christians about the Lord and neglect those whom Christ called us to reach, the lost.  If we trust God then why are we not continually spending time with Him, continually trusting, praising, and sharing our faith with the lost?  Remember it all starts with time but continues with hope, praise and sharing our faith.  Are you consistent?  If not today make a u-turn and start fresh, because God allows u-turn, its called repentance.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

Good morning,

Genesis 29:15-30, vs. 18 “Now Jacob loved Rachel; so he said, “I will serve (labored) you seven years for Rachel your younger daughter.”

For those who are in love or have been in love at some point will agree that there is a level of service you do for the one you love. It’s not out of obligation or guilt but out of the abundance of love flowing from within expressed. I call it the outworking of the internal. These are the times you find yourself doing things you would not normally going extra mile, constantly thinking about the one you love and wondering, how did you make it all these years without him or her? It’s a good feeling but I have come to learn that love is more than just a feeling, it’s a choice. The other thing that makes it to blossom even more is when you learn the language of love your partner responds to. What you respond to might not be what your partner responds to.

Out of the abundance of this love one man asked, where does it go after one gets married? I have spoken to some people and it was clear, what they once had was no longer present or if it was, less attention was given to it. Jacob was in love with Rachel, so he served her father seven years so as to get her and what happened, he found himself with Leah, Rachel’s older sister exactly the opposite of what he desired. This is where my scripture comes in, someone in a relationship or marriage is feeling like they labored for Rachel but ended up with Leah. What happened to the Rachel you labored for? How did she (he) turn out to be Leah after marriage (this is for both man and woman).? Are you feeling like you were tricked into to marrying Leah thinking it was Rachel? do you now get rid of Leah to find Rachel?. Jacob was disappointed to have married Leah but he did not get rid of her, since he still desired to marry Rachel, he still had a chance and therefore labored another 7 years for her. This is what I call patience laboring in good times and in bad times to bring out what is missing. So Jacob had two wives, Leah and Rachel sisters but different. Both have different qualities and are all significant and vital.

Where does this leave us? Should we be in more than one relationship because what we desired did not come forth in the other? What we labored for was not birthed and so we throw in the towel? For me I see an opportunity to labor for a Rachel within the presence of a Leah. I have heard stories about people who labored for Rachel but felt like they ended up with Leah therefore labored in their marriage for some time without giving up to be married to Rachel without giving up on Leah. Same woman, double qualities. They confessed they almost threw away the best gift from God. They just realized there was a Rachel trapped inside their Leah’s they needed to labor for. They learnt to speak the love language their mates could understand and not their own love language they hoped their mates would understand. The more they did, the more the beauty both inside and outside was revealed. They came in as separate pieces together and began to assemble their love together, fitting each piece in it’s rightful place without trying to force around peg on a square hole. They learnt that it’s more than being together, it’s about assembly because you can be together but feel separate. Assembly requires work and skills building together. They didn’t want to try to separate a Rachel and a Leah, they discovered they could assemble both together after all they came from the same womb. Don’t dismiss Leah when she is a Rachel to be discovered. We can have extra ordinary relationships out of the ordinary because we have learnt to maximize opportunities within what we already have to bring out what we never had. Blessings Evans

title.rendered: Consequences of a Divided House, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“And Jesus knew their thoughts, and said to them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation; and every city or house divided against itself shall not stand.” (Matt 12:25)

I grew up playing a variety of sports.  You win some and you loose some, but you should never be divided, because then you are defeated.  There were some teams that I played on that fought very hard in the game however they were fighting against one another.  Perhaps one player missed a goal, fumbled a pass, or failed to block a goal, or made some sort of bad decision, which resulted in the team getting on his case.  Then instead of the team being unified against the opposition, they fought against one another.  When the team is divided the whole team has lost before the game is even over.

Similarly, a man was brought to Jesus one day possessed of the devil, which was blind and mute (unable to speak).  Jesus healed the man of the demonic influence, so that he could both talk and see.  Two different responses arose from the onlookers.  “The people were astonished and said, “Could this be the Son of David?”  These people were not too sure of what to make of this miraculous power exhibited by Jesus.  The question posed was not if Jesus was a magician, but if he was the Messiah, as the Messiah was expected to perform miracles upon His coming.  On the other hand “when the Pharisees heard this, they said, ‘It is only by Beelzebub, the prince of demons that this fellow drives out demons.’”  The common people were unsure, yet accurate, while the Pharisees were confident in their estimation yet cold not be further from the truth, Jesus.  Jesus deals with their question knowing their thoughts and spoke about the inability of a divided kingdom, city and house to stand in light of its division.  His argument is clear: any kingdom, city, or household that develops internal strife will result in destroying itself.  When a church is divided, a marriage, a friendship, a relationship, a company or business, etc…it cannot stand in that state.  In fact it is not standing but falling and failing.  In any boxing match when a man is not standing it is because he has just gotten punched to the canvas, and is receiving a ten count to get up.  When loved ones punch each other, both loose, and both fall.  Sure one may feel that they have one-upped on the other, but in reality Jesus knows our thoughts just as He knew the thoughts of the Pharisees.

Jesus said “But if I drive out demons by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.”  Jesus’ scenario was dealing with a demonized man, but whenever a household fights against one another, are they not as well being influenced by the enemy.   Paul echoes the heart of Jesus saying “For our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the powers of this dark world and against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms.”  We need to recognize the focal point of the battle, and unite; strengthening our position against the enemy, because any team, relationship, or unit divided is already defeated by the enemy.   Jesus said “He who is not with me is against me, and he who does not gather with me scatters.”  Jesus cannot be divided against His Body (the church).  Then why are we fighting against the things of God, and fighting amongst ourselves?  If we are on Christ’s side then we should be displaying gathering not scattering.  We should be gathering forgiveness, truth, and the fruit of the spirit toward one another, and stop scattering dissention, bitterness, strife, envy, Unforgiveness, jealousy, and selfishness against one another.  It is impossible to be divided and standing.  When there is division everyone loses.  How is your house looking these days divided or united? Until the nets are filled….
Blessings, Phil

Good morning,

Matthew 17:27, “….go to the sea, cast in a hook, and take the fish that comes up first. And when you have opened its mouth, you will find a piece of money;] take that and give it to them for Me and you.”

I hate being in debt, anyone join me? I don’t like owing anyone, Romans 13:8, says “Owe no man any thing, but to love one another:” To me this is a clear indication that even God hates to see His children debt. That is why he had to do something about our debt of sin, the reason we pray Matthew 6:12, “Forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors”(NIV). Who in their right mind would want to owe someone else? And yet we find that we are debtors to other people. The most common debt of our day is financial debt. We owe the credit card companies, car payments, appliances, accumulated electrical, gas bills to mention a few. I believe with all my heart that debt can be a disease that needs to be cured before it destroys a Christian. Some bring this disease upon themselves being careless and misusing the resources God has provided for them or  to some life circumstances has brought them there.

In Matthew 17, it happened that Peter and Jesus owed the temple taxes. The bible says the wealth of the wicked is stored for God’s children right? How come Jesus knowing about this still was reliable for taxes? Didn’t the bible says, “the earth is the Lord’s and the fullness of it?”, This to me is more to our learning. Yes we are the children of God and God provides for us and God wants us to live a abundant life but He will not let us ignore our responsibility to others (government, companies, those we owe).

Jesus turns to Peter and says, “”….go to the sea, cast in a hook, and take the fish that comes up first. And when you have opened its mouth, you will find a piece of money;] take that and give it to them for Me and you.” Here is what got me, instead of Jesus calling money into existence so that Peter could use to pay taxes, He gives him an instruction that is mind beating. Backing up to Mathew 15, Jesus fed 4,000 with seven loaves of bread and few little fish. Why couldn’t He perform a miracle right there to clear up this debt? Why is it that we have Christians in debt who do not want to do anything about it? They are sitting hoping that God will perform a miracle right before their eyes and their debts will disappear. I know God can and we know of some people who have experienced it but we cannot limit God to one method of helping us deal with our problems.  Isn’t it clear that if we owe, we should find a way to pay it back? And our prayer is Lord provide away, we want to owe man nothing? Jesus provides and Peter had a job to do and here is what he had to do, GO, CAST, TAKE, OPEN, FIND, GIVE. title.rendered: Stop so you can GO!, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“The Spirit told Philip, “Go to that chariot and stay near it.” Then Philip ran up to the chariot and heard the man reading Isaiah the prophet. “Do you understand what you are reading?” Philip asked. And he gave orders to stop the chariot. Then both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water and Philip baptized him. When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord suddenly took Philip away, and the eunuch did not see him again, but went on his way rejoicing.”
(Acts 8:29-30; 38-39)

During war time in the military when a platoon is trying to find the enemy and the military leader suddenly places his hand in the air and closes his fight, all his immediately stop.  Why because their eyes are on their leader, and one more step could be a land mind and blow off their leg, or end their very life.  Even towns and cities know the value of stopping which is why they have placed stop signs and stop lights to better control traffic.

There are times when God wants us to stop and not take another step forward.  Perhaps one is reading God’s word and a certain truth seems to bring off the page into your spirit and it stops you in your tracks.  If you’re like most, you stop for a moment because it’s like a stop light, and then you envision a green light and you go.  However, when God stops you as you are reading His word, it is because there is a truth, a warning, an encouragement, a piece of wisdom, etc… that He has for you now.  In our church one member was reading the Scriptures and the words from Genesis, “Who told you that,” seemed to leap off the page at them.  This in turn caused her to weigh the words others said to them, or perhaps even their own thoughts that came into their mind.  Have you said to yourself, “I’m a failure,” or were you ever told hurtful words such as “you’ll never amount to anything.”  Who told you that!  Did God say that to you?  When we are stopped in our tracks as we read God’s word, there is a reason and God knows that reason, and failure to stop at that verse, passage, question, word, command will result in a consequence.  A soldier failing to stop could be killed, a car failing to stop at a light may crash, a Christian failing to stop will feel the effect and it could be disastrous.  Just as the military leader signals stop because he senses grave danger ahead, how much more should we as Christians stop, because when God says “STOP,” He sees what is ahead for us, and failing to stop when He says stop will not turn out in our favor.

The Spirit told Philip to go and STOP at the chariot, but never gave the reason to Philip.  Philip ran and STOPPED hearing the eunuch reading the Scriptures, and Phillip shared Jesus with him.  Imagine if Philip didn’t STOP.  Who would have explained the passage of Scripture to the eunuch?  Then the newly converted eunuch gave orders to stop the chariot. Then both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water and Philip baptized him.  However when they came up out of the water the Holy Spirit had translated Philip 30 miles away to another town.  This may be difficult to fathom, but if Jesus can be taken from death to life, then Philip can be taken from town to town.  Imagine if they had never stopped for the baptism and at specific time the Holy Spirit was going to take Philip away, then who would have baptized the eunuch.

When God tells you to STOP it is for your own good, so that you can GO right!  Is there a verse, passage of Scripture, habit, etc…, that God has said STOP?  What are you moving for?  Today is the day to STOP in your tracks, because the next step may be something that you can’t handle without receiving what you need when you are stopped.  Even a car stops for gas, can’t God’s people stop from Him!  Until the nets are filled….Blessings, Pastor Phil

Good morning,

Rom 1:28 “Furthermore, since they did not think it worthwhile to retain the knowledge of God, he gave them over to a depraved mind, to do what ought not to be done.”

Moral perversion brings mental perversion.  Paul writes about those that did not like to retain God in their minds and how their minds were affected by such a decision.  The mind is a very powerful place.  Perhaps the human mind is one of the most powerful things on earth next to God.  With the mind humankind has placed men on the moon, we can send information by the click of a button around the globe, we can breathe underwater using SCUBA gear, etc…. our mind controls our actions, and whoever or whatever controls our minds will certainly control us.

At the time when Paul was writing Paul addressed that there were those people who refused to see it to be rational and relevant to acknowledge God.  If one acknowledges God then it stands to reason that the one is accountable to God as their Creator.  Many do not desire to acknowledge God and therefore create idols and systems that are secular (without God).  As ones conscience convicts them of breaking God’s Law, and as Creation proves there is a Creator, some still refuse to give in and submit to God, and one’s pride keeps them from retaining the knowledge of God.  One can sit in a class and hear information, or read a book, but retaining information is when that information becomes part of a person.  Each of us can attest to this when we have studied for our tests, and although we reviewed the material, there was some information, or formulas that we did not retain at that time, and the test revealed that to us.

What did God do because many felt it undesirable, or unnecessary to retain the knowledge of God?  God “gave them over to a depraved (reprobate-KJV) mind to do what ought not to be done.”  The word “reprobate” (adokimion) means “rejected after testing.”  God would reject those that rejected him, because He gave many chances to them, notice they were rejected after testing, not prior to.  Man was created in God’s image and because of sin that image has been distorted, and only through Christ can that image be restored to its rightful place whereby God intended it to be.  At salvation God pronounced a divorce from us to our father the Devil that “nourished us” with the lust of the eyes, the lust of the flesh, and the pride of life, and called us out of darkness into His marvelous light.  John writes that men stay in darkness because men love darkness rather then light, because light exposes us for who we really are.  Just as the sunlight reveals the dust on the surface of a table that has just been dusted, likewise does the light of God’s truth reveal our lives, our minds in truth.  Hebrews 4:12 states, “For the word of God is living and active. Sharper than any double-edged sword,…it judges the thoughts and attitudes of the heart [mind].”  God gave these men up to minds which held thoughts that He disapproved of to the judgment of their sin.  That sinful mind will go head to head with God on Judgment and their will be no excuses to appease the Judge of the universe.  These men because of their darkened minds did those acts which ought not to be done.”  Through our conscience and Creation, God still has shown us right from wrong.  We desperately need Christ so we can think right, about God, others, and ourselves.  Is He in you!  “Let this mind be in you which was also in Christ Jesus (Phil 2:5).”  Don’t only read His Word, but obey it!

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

Good morning,
Psalm 100:1-5, 1 Make a joyful shout to the LORD, all you lands! 2Serve the LORD with gladness; Come before His presence with singing. 3Know that the LORD, He is God; It is He who has made us, and not we ourselves;[1] We are His people and the sheep of His pasture. 4Enter into His gates with thanksgiving, And into His courts with praise. Be thankful to Him, and bless His name. 5For the LORD is good; His mercy is everlasting, And His truth endures to all generations.
You’ve heard me say this before, it’s very important to start your day on a good note, it has a way of affecting your entire day if started well. To be honest with you, I tend to be very busy and spent many times but it matters a lot to me how I start my day.
We all have a way of affecting how we start the day, it’s a choice that we’ve got to make and declare otherwise we become victims of stress, frustrations and lack happiness trying to do what is right. The bible tells us that the joy of the Lord is my strength. If we take a close look at the word joy, it’s more than happiness for happiness tend to go with how you feel at a given time especially when everything is going the right way, while joy comes when you know that regardless of what you have to deal with whether going forward of backward, you will make it in other words rejoicing in the end result rather than the process. The joy of the Lord should make us comfortable in the situation we are in. You can be in a storm and still sleep comfortably.
Psalm 100 is a psalm of joy and singing, it starts with make a joyful shout to the Lord. I don’t have to shout joyfully to be heard by people, I can shout inside and when my inside is affected, definitely my outside appearance will be the result of what is going on inside. Serving the Lord with gladness is awesome for I know that whenever I sit to work at my station, I’m working and serving the Lord. This is a blessed time where I come in the morning to work and say Lord, I thank you for another opportunity to serve you in my department and serve others that I may shine for you at my work place. You see His word says that whatsoever thy hand finds to do, do it with all of you might without murmuring or complaining and the Lord of reward shall reward thee.
Come before His presence with singing. I believe that music is the greatest tool used to uplift or to depress. There is nothing that people respond to like music and that is why we listen to music over and over again, we can have hundreds of music collections. The bible says that the Lord inhabits the praises of His people and we do a lot of praises through singing and listening to music. I love music and I can’t work like I need to without it because the more I praise my Lord through music, the more He energizes me to do my work. You got to give something to get something. A song with you will help you go through the day. When King Saul was being tormented by evil spirits, guess what they did, they had David playing music in his presence and the more he played, the more the evil spirit left could be near him. Replace your worries and anxieties with a song in your ear.
Enter into His gates with thanksgiving and into His courts with praise. I love this line for this reminds me to go beyond where I am. Entering into His gates and into His courts allows me to leave outside everything that will interfere with my praise while I’m serving Him everyday. There is power in thanksgiving and when I enter into His gates, I begin to see that He has done more and with that I need to thank Him. This is a choice everyone has to make, yes we will have so much on our plates to accomplish and yes we will be dealing with tough customers on the phone but we have been given the power to change the course of the day by allowing the joy of the Lord to be our strength. Keep a song with you, enter His gates and into His courts, refuse anything that will steal your praise, thanksgiving heart and joy and be a beacon of light. I’ve made up my mind to start and finish the day well: I’ve said it, I mean it and I’m here to represent it!!!!! Blessings Evans

Good morning,

Colossians 1:28, “… Christ in you, the hope of glory”

Don’t know how to begin this but there some things about hope that keeps a man alive. As long as hope is there, regardless of what one has to go through, deal with and suffer, there will be something inside called hope propelling him or her to keep fighting till the end. The people who have lost hope throw in the towel and call it a quit but the people who have hope, keep standing regardless of the time and season. Let’s look at the definition of hope, hope is being in the mode of expectation, it’s anticipating, wishing, looking forward to. It’s knowing that something is going to happen or something is going to come but you don’t know when and how it will show up or happen, all you are doing is keeping the hope alive with your eyes opened.

Hebrews 11:1, “Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen”. Faith is believing what is not there but knowing that it will happen. The verse begins by saying that “Now faith is the substance of things”, substance in a smaller word is the core thing, the main thing to help one hope for something. With this I would say that Faith is the main thing that keeps hope alive. We are told that hope is the evidence of things not seen. There is no need to have faith for something that you can visibly see and touch for it’s already there. How can one hope for something that is present?, you hope for something that has not materialized yet and you can’t just stop thinking about it, talking about it, watching for it and waiting for it to show up. In Luke 15, Jesus talks about a father who had two sons, we know the story is about the prodigal son. The younger son took away his in heritance and went to a far country and there wasted his substance with riotous living. When he came to his senses after spending everything and had nothing left, he decided to go back home. Meanwhile his father had been hoping, praying, waiting, watching to see his son coming home one day. Luke 15:20, “And he rose, and came to his father. But when he was yet a great way off, his father saw him, and had compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him”. This father was not just passing by then saw his son, no, he had been hoping and because of that hope, he could not go into depression and fear could not keep him down for hope was keeping him alive and when what he hoped for arrived, he ran to receive his son. Hope will make you embrace promises, desires at a distance and when they appear, you will run to receive it.

A person who is hoping has themselves at rest, Psalm 16:9, “Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoices: my flesh shall rest in hope”. There is nothing as bad as being in a restless position and there is nothing that you can do about it. The bible says that we cannot even add a minute to our lives therefore we rejoice and hope that the one who made us will be faithful to fulfill what He has promised and all we got to do is be in the hope mode. Hebrews 11:6, “For without faith (hope) it is impossible to please Him, for He that comes to God must first believe that He is  and that He is a rewarder of them that diligently seek Him”. Without faith, you and I cannot please Him.

People on hoping mode also do other things to keep that hope alive, Psalm 71:14, “But I will hope continually, and will yet praise thee more and more”. One can be on the hoping mode but can also be complaining and checking the time when it will happen. As for the Psalmist he says that he will hope continually, daily, consistently and to keep his hope alive, he will yet praise him more and more. The reason why praising him while on the hoping mode is vital, it keeps fueling faith in you to trust Him even more and not give up.

Colossians 1:28, “… Christ in you, the hope of glory”. What a way to hope when the greatest one is inside you. Christ in us gives us assurance that as we hope, He is there with us and will never leave. When we are getting discouraged and feel like giving up, His words of comfort and hope will keep us alive and kicking to trust Him. Him ordering the steps and guiding us teaches us to hope in Him even more for if He brought us this far, He can take us that far. If He provided for us then, He will do it again. If He fought for us then, we hope that He will do it again. If He provided a job then, He will do it again. We Hope in Him all day long. Have you lost hope that you could get married, be in ministry, be used of Him, achieve that career or goal, become somebody or whatever it is? Don’t let hope die for He is in you, keep pumping it and living to the fullest, exercise things that will keep your hope alive and remember that Christ in you, the hope of glory, the hope of beauty, the hope of splendor, hope of magnificence, hope of wonder, hope of brilliance and many more. Keep Hope Alive!!!!! Blessings Ev

title.rendered: God Can Give You Favor with the Ungodly, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Col 3:22 Slaves, obey your earthly masters in everything; and do it, not only when their eye is on you and to win their favor, but with sincerity of heart and reverence for the Lord.

We all desire to be liked by others.   As you look through God’s Word you will certainly see that God’s people especially His leaders, were not always given positive treatment as some were mocked, threatened, beaten, and even killed.  Think of Moses who at one time had the favor of Egypt as a prince, and was treated as an outlaw upon returning to free the Israelites.  Moses went from friend to foe, as he “feel out of favor” with the Egyptians.  The Apostles were all killed for their bold preaching of the gospel.  However, despite these truths there is another side to the same coin.  You see God has a way of intervening in relationships and granting favor from the unsaved, ungodly, toward the godly. What do I mean, well let me explain.

Daniel and his three friends were brought into captivity into the land of Babylon.  This was an ungodly land, with ungodly leaders where pagan gods were worshipped.  Even though he was in captivity Daniel gained favor with the ungodly leaders in Babylon, all whom had the “power” to take Daniel’s life from him at any given time.  Even though Daniel was in such an ungodly environment the Scripture points out Da 1:8 “But Daniel resolved not to defile himself with the royal food and wine, and he asked the chief official for permission not to defile himself this way.”  His mind was made up to be pure before God and not to follow the old saying, “when in Rome do as the Romans do.”  No, he would do as God desired, period.  Because of this Daniel gained favor with the most unlikely people of that ungodly land, and that is the leaders, specifically the princes and kings that ruled the nation.  Look at Daniel’s testimony.

Da 1:9 Now God had caused the official (prince of the eunuchs) to show favor and sympathy to Daniel,

Da 2:46 Then King Nebuchadnezzar fell prostrate before Daniel and paid him honor and ordered that an offering and incense be presented to him. Da 2:47 The king said to Daniel, “Surely your God is the God of gods and the Lord of kings and a revealer of mysteries, for you were able to reveal this mystery.”   Da 2:48 Then the king placed Daniel in a high position and lavished many gifts on him. He made him ruler over the entire province of Babylon and placed him in charge of all its wise men.”

Da 5:29 Then at [King] Belshazzar’s command, Daniel was clothed in purple, a gold chain was placed around his neck, and he was proclaimed the third highest ruler in the kingdom.

Da 6:1 It pleased [King] Darius to appoint 120 satraps to rule throughout the kingdom, Da 6:2 with three administrators over them, one of whom was Daniel. The satraps were made accountable to them so that the king might not suffer loss. Da 6:3 Now Daniel so distinguished himself among the administrators and the satraps by his exceptional qualities that the king planned to set him over the whole kingdom.

How Did Daniel gain favor with the ungodly princes and kings?  He simply maintained a commitment to God.  He told the kings things that were true that was bad news about them, he broke the laws of the land in order to obey the Law of God, and he of course operated and so flourished in the spiritual gifts God had given him.  He would not compromise his relationship with God, and always took care of his three friends.

Application:  In an ungodly world, keep your commitment to God no matter what.  God can bring favor with the ungodly toward you. Ps 46:10 “Be still, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations (heathen-KJV), I will be exalted in the earth.”

Thanks
Evans

Life is full of up and downs, a lot of challenges to go with it. You will definitely agree with me that there are days you feel like you are winning and there are days when you feel like a failure. Often times I have used the word “season modes” for every season presents it’s weather and everyone has to learn to adapt in every season otherwise you become a victim. This day I want to talk about tools. I am yet to meet someone who is the same year in year out in their spiritual walk. I have come to discover that at times even the preachers go dry, and they are left with no power and no strength to fight the good fight of a soldier. If the preachers, pastors, deacons, board members, evangelists are not exempt from the dry and burn outs seasons, then we also need to understand that it is possible to be in the same positions. I wouldn’t say that this is a bad thing, though some may not agree with me, but I don’t want to be perfect!!!!. perfect people don’t need help. I have also come to discover that God may take you through a process and when you think you now have everything in place to make you perfect, He will relocate you again for His purpose is not to make you confident in yourself but confident in Him.

We are all tools of a kind designed and made by God. Each tool has been made for a specific purpose and that tool cannot accomplish what it was never designed to do. Let’s look at some other words for tools, it’s instrument, device, gadget, utensil, apparatus, appliance. Let me take the word tool and make use of it. Any tool that need sharpening has to go through that process before it can effectively be used. A sharpened tool will give you a better result compared to a blunt tool. Not only will a sharp tool give you a better result, it will make the work faster and easier and you will use less energy to have the job done. You cannot force a lawn mower to trim the fence, it was never designed for that. Each and every tool was designed for a specific task and so is with every believer, we are designed for specific tasks, callings and ministries and we cannot go around trying to do everything that we were never called to do. I was never called to sing, therefore I don’t need to appear at a choir practice for I will mess up everything. When you know what you have been called to do, you will not just have a passion for it but you will also be good at it. God has invested in each of us diversified gifts that can be utilized for we are His instrument but….

Every tool used at times get out of place, and has to be tuned, sharpened, oiled, repaired and the like and the Lord is saying to us in Isaiah 41:15, “Behold, I will make thee a new sharp threshing instrument having teeth”. “Behold”, not only is He telling you and I to observe, watch, see, take a look at, view but He is also telling those around us to watch. You can be effective, but there comes a time when your effectiveness reduces and you have to come back to the one who is using you as a tool for sharpening. Watch the way He puts it, “I will make thee”, If He does not do it, it cannot be done, if He does not fix it, it cannot be fixed, therefore we call on Him to sharpen that part of our lives that has gone blunt. I just checked and another word for blunt is dull. Blunt tools don’t look attractive and most of the time, they have dents on the blade and are rusty. When you begin to sharpen it, expect it to sparkle. All the dents will diminish, it will shine and the owner of the tool is happy about using a sharpened tool. He is sharpening it because He wants to use it and not put in display.

Our prayer lives, witnessing skills, reading of the word, faith, hope, working skills, wisdom, passions, dreams, desires, relationships need to be sharpened. I know in this group there are tools designed by God that have become dull, dormant, rusty and blunt. Someone looks like an old, beaten tool that has been abused in the hands of the wrong person. You’ve lost your effectiveness, you’ve tried hard to be used but because you are blunt, more energy is used to make something out of it. The sign of the anointing is when you can take less and do much with it, Holy Ghost knows how to sharpen us and put us back to work. Regardless of what size the tool is, when it’s sharpened and used in the right field in which it was designed for, watch and you will see marvelous results. He says again in Isaiah 41:15, “… thou shall thresh the mountains, and beat them small, and shall make thee hills of chaff”. What a description of what will happen when you and I are sharpened, for we will thresh the mountains and beat them small. Hebrews 4:12, “The word of the Lord is living and powerful, and sharper than any double edged sword…”. We thank Him for His word is our sharpener. Where in your life have you gone blunt, mark that it’s not beginning but you already had it before and it was effective at one point but in the process of time, you, the tool fell in wrong hands that abused you as a tool or you were in the right hand but you lost your effectiveness and now you are blunt and dull, you have dents all over and anything you try to do is yielding less strength or no strength. Jump into the Lord’s workshop and let Him sharpen you again. He wants to use you, but with you blunt, you will not be effective. Blessings Evans

title.rendered: Do You “Know” God? Level 2, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Rom 1:21-23 “For although they knew God, they neither glorified him as God nor gave thanks to him, but their thinking became futile and their foolish hearts were darkened. Although they claimed to be wise, they became fools and exchanged the glory of the immortal God for images made to look like mortal man and birds and animals and reptiles.”

Recently we looked at Romans 1:19 and how Paul spoke about those who “knew” God by Creation, and how this alone leaves the relationship with Him at the level of what we may refer to as an acquaintance.   This level of knowing God is sufficient to make man responsible, but is not by itself sufficient to accomplish his salvation.

Paul continues in Romans 1, about knowing God where he spoke about those that “knew God.”  If these people knew God, why do they display a lack of thanks to Him, and why foolish, darkened hearts that worshipped idols? The Greek word used here for know is “Ginosko” which means to allow, be aware of, feel, or perceive, etc…  If these people knew God they certainly had a “funny” way of showing it.  When looking into the history of humanity a willful rejection of God’s revelation of Himself can be traced.  Even though these knew God via Creation, humanity failed to act upon it, and thus God was not worshipped by those whom Paul is addressing here.  Humanity was created to worship, and if humanity fails to worship the One True God, they will worship someone or something else certainly, and in this case their choice idol was images made to look like man, as well an the animal species.

Recall in Exodus when Moses was on Mt. Sinai receiving God’s Law.  While Moses was on the mountain where were the rest of the Israelites? These were at the bottom of the mountain creating an idol, the Golden Calf.  Now this strikes me with great humor on the part of the High Priest Aaron.  Aaron tries to explain away the Golden Calf, even though he clearly submitted to the will of the people in their darkened imagination and desire to create a god for them to worship.  After collecting the gold earrings and trinkets, he melted them down and out of the pliable gold, fashioned a Golden calf.  When Moses comes back form Sinai, Aaron tells him “They said to me, ‘Make us gods who will go before us.  So I told them, ‘Whoever has any gold jewelry, take it off.’ Then they gave me the gold, and I threw it into the fire, and out came this calf!”  This excuse makes me laugh that Aaron threw some gold in the fire and like a “genie” a calf popped out!

Many people gather the darkened imaginations of others and fashion those ideas together and create a god to suit their sins, one they are comfortable with.  Then they worship the god by their foolish darkened hearts.  For this reason god commands us to love not the world, and if anyone loves the world the love of God is not in him.  The world is a system of thinking that is opposed to the God of truth, justice, love, and holiness.  Adam tried to hide on God in the trees when he sinned because his heart became darkened.  It would be easier to try and cover the brilliance of sun with a blanket then to try hiding from God.  David wrote, “Where can I flee from Your presence….”  Filled with “intellectual pride” many “claim to be wise,” and try and justify their idol worship, just to reveal “their foolish hearts are truly darkened.”  We need to be in God’s Word daily so that the light of His truth can flood our hearts daily, and leave no room for the darkness to enter in and thus worship Him! Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

Good morning,

Romans 13:11, “And do this, knowing the time, that now it is high time to awake out of sleep; for now our salvation is nearer than when we first believed”

When you have prayed, you have developed faith and you have patiently waited there comes at time you keep on looking to see the manifestation of the Lord but as human beings there are times we loose heart and not because we have stopped trusting but because we are not sure whether what we prayed and believed was of God. Something was shown to you, you believed it, confessed it and prayed it but now you are not sure whether you heard the Lord well simply because the prayer has not been answered. It’s a little bit tough when you don’t want to waste time praying for something that may not work and you don’t want to give up praying for something that is just about to happen, ’cause at the point of just giving up could have been the point of getting a breakthrough.

Romans 13:11, “And do this, knowing the time, that now it is high time to awake out of sleep”. I have seen this with the marathon guys, when they start the marathon, they start with a lot of strength, courage, anticipation, and enthusiasm, they can’t wait to go through the finish line, the more they run the more some runners try to keep up with the speed and that is also the time some drop out of the race for they can not keep up. At times it gets tougher, one part tells them to keep running for there is a prize the other tells them to give up for you have tried. The bible says,  “And do this” to which I could say keep running the marathon, “Knowing the time”, which I could say knowing so much time you have invested, you have come from far, the faith you have built towards it, you have stuck with it up to this moment. “That now it is high time to awake out of sleep”, wake up from your dormant stage, wake up from your pity party, how about wake up from your fantasy land and the wish land and keep running. Don’t you realize that you have gone too far to go back? You have invested too much to give up running? Don’t you know that you are not where you started ? Wake up from the fear and the lies from the enemy that tells you you have waited too long for the breakthrough, blessings, and victories to come through for now our salvation is nearer than when we first believed.  Friends, our salvation (blessings, victories, breakthrough) is nearer than when we first believed (had faith). I haven’t arrived yet but I’m getting closer and closer to what the Lord promised, I can smell it at a distance, I can feel it, it looks far but it’s near than I think. For those who drive or even those who do not drive, look for a car and check the side mirrors on the co drivers side, what does it say “Objects on the mirror are much closer than they appear”. What more can I say, the objects look far away from your side (co driver’s side) but the truth of the matter is, they are very nearer than you think. See the Lord is on the wheel, driver’s side. He sees things using His driver’s mirror. The objects appear as they are. On the co driver’s side where we are sitting, our mirrors show the objects (blessings) far off, may we not feel discouraged when our mirrors tells us it’s far away and begin to visualize it using the Lord’s mirror. Do you the things you have been believing God for are very much closer than they appear? I choose to look at things from His mirror and by doing so, looking at my mirror would give me the hope and confidence to trust Him for though my mirror shows my blessing is far, I know for a fact that they are very close and all I need to do is keep trusting and running the race. Hebrews 12:1&2, “run this race with patience, looking unto Jesus the author (start) and the finisher (perfector) of our faith.

Have you given up on something because it was just to far off? You stopped praying, believing and went to a dormant sleeping stage? wake up from your sleep, and keep running towards your destination for your salvation is much nearer than when you first believed. It looks so far yet it’s so near. Don’t abort it when you are just about to arrive, don’t faint when you are almost crossing the finish line. I will not retreat nor surrender until I have made it to the other side. Blessings Evans

Good morning,

Philippians 3:13&14, “Brethren, I count not myself to have apprehended; but this is one thing I do, I forget those things which are behind reaching unto those things which are before, I press towards the mark of the high calling of God in Jesus Christ Jesus”

I think that one of the greatest struggles for a Christian is trying to keep up with the Lord. Often times as we walk with the Lord we get distracted on the way and we loose focus and it takes us time to get back to where we need to be. Also few people get beaten by their own opinion about themselves especially affected and infected by their past and so they cannot progress. We know for sure that there is nothing good in man except Christ and in as much as we have failed miserably and we ought to be thrown into the lake of fire, Christ in us cannot deny Himself but casting us away. The fact is we don’t deserve to live but the truth is He has called us His own. We are adopted to be sons and daughters of God.

In Romans 7, Paul talks so much about struggling with sin, how he learnt what sin is, he then tells us of what sin does and then he concludes the chapter in Romans 7:24, “O wretched man that I am, who shall rescue me from this body of death? 25, “Thanks be to God-through Jesus Christ our Lord!. So then, I myself in my mind am a slave to God’s law, but in the sinful nature a slave to the law of sin”. He has discovered how he is vulnerable to sin but he does not leave it there for he is transitioning from what he knows about himself and puts everything aside and begins a new chapter on a positive thought because of who God is to him. Romans 8:1, “There is therefore no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus”. It’s very easy to dwell on who you used to be and this message has been bothering me for days for at times I concentrate on who I used to be instead of looking at what the Lord is doing in me right now. We can’t deny the fact that we all have histories, we are all from the past, good and bad things happened but mostly we concentrate on the bad things that happened. We keep on bringing to remembrance what the Lord forgave us for and forgot about and instead of us progressing to the healing part of our growth, we keep on falling to the same things we thought we dealt with.

Have you ever assassinated victories in your life because you still dwelt on what you used to be? cried yourself to sleep, couldn’t reach to that level of trusting someone again with your life because of what they did to you, you are haunted by a memory, an incident, an accident and you can’t see clearly where you are going. I am terrified of becoming who I used to be, just the thought of it make me sick but I cannot undo what’s been done, I cannot change where I have come from and I cannot waste my time trying to fix what has been broken. I am too wise for that, every time I bring to remembrance my past failures, I want them to remind me that they were the bridge the Lord would use to tailor me to become who I am today. As usual I would call them points of reference and now when I meet someone and tell them, “I know what you are going through, I’ve been there”, that is to give them hope to know that if God was gracious enough to bring me up, God will be gracious enough to bring them up. But if I don’t see my past as bridge that was used to get me this far, it’s time to bury the past and leave it in the sea of forgetfulness. As long as the past haunts you, it’s time to put that ghost to rest for good otherwise you will not move far in Christ. Paul tells us how wretched he is but then he moves to the next verse and thanks the Lord for he is reminded that what he is not, he can be if Christ is in his life.

Philippians 3:13&14, “Brethren, I count not myself to have apprehended; but this is one thing I do, I forget those things which are behind reaching unto those things which are before, I press towards the mark of the high calling of God in Jesus Christ Jesus”. In NIV it says, “Brothers, I do not consider myself yet to have taken hold of it”. What an indication that the struggle continues, he knows where he has come from, what he used to do by persecuting Christians and then he got saved and the struggle continues. But this is one thing I do, I forget those things which are behind reaching unto those things which are before. He knows that for him to progress, he has to put all the past failures behind otherwise his next move will be hindered by that. I press towards the mark of the high call calling of God in Christ Jesus, meaning, I have a destiny and so I press. The word press does not mean walk into it, but fight your way through, pressing also means applying some force and that is resisting the past that tries to assassinate your move. Now mark how he puts it, pressing TOWARD (FORWARD) toward the mark, the goal Christ set for me from the beginning. I am looking at the end result while I am still moving towards it. Talk to God about who you used to be and who you are and He will talk to you about the mark of His high calling in your life. We as believers have received a calling and not just a calling but a HIGH CALLING and with that in mind, YOU CAN’T CHANGE WHERE YOU HAVE COME FROM, BUT SURE YOU CAN CHANGE WHERE YOU ARE GOING BECAUSE OF THE HIGH CALLING. YOU CANNOT UN DO WHAT’S BEEN DONE BUT YOU CAN UN DO WHAT’S NOT BEEN DONE. Break out of what is putting you down and forget those things which are behind and begin to press on towards the mark. Blessings Ev
